      <script type='text/javascript'>
         $(function(){
            //Handle the enter/return keypress for the login form 
            $('.header-login-input').keypress(function(e){
               //Submit the form on press enter/return
               if(e.which==13){
                  submitLoginForm();
               }
            });
         });
         
         /**
          * Submit the login form (first make sure there is data)
          */
         function submitLoginForm(){
            if($('#header-login-username').val()!='' && $('#header-login-password').val()){
               $('#login-form').submit();
            }
         }
         
         /**
          * Open a new window (for instance, some errors and the 'help' on the application preview/editor)
          */
         function OpenWindow(Address, HelpID) {
            window.open(Address +'?ID=' + HelpID + '&Popup=1','HelPWin','directory=0,scrollbars=1,resizable=yes,height=350,width=450');
         }
      </script>

<script type="text/javascript">
$(document).ready(function() {
   $("#advanced-link").click(function() {
      $("[name=simple_advanced]").val("advanced");
      $("#simple-filter").hide("fade", 1000, function() {
         $("#advanced-filter").show("fade", 1000);
      });
   });
   $("#simple-link").click(function() {
      $("[name=simple_advanced]").val("simple");
      $("#advanced-filter").hide("fade", 1000, function() {
         $("#simple-filter").show("fade", 1000);
      });
   });
});

// preload the arrow images
var rightArrowImage = new Image;
var downArrowImage = new Image;
rightArrowImage.src = '/images/arrow_right.gif';
downArrowImage.src = '/images/arrow_down.gif';

function expandFairs(fairIDs)
{

   for (fairID in fairIDs) {
      var fairSection = document.getElementById('fairSection['+ fairIDs[fairID] +']');
      fairSection.style.display = 'block';
      var arrowImage = document.images['arrowImage['+fairIDs[fairID]+']'];
      arrowImage.src = downArrowImage.src;
   }
   //$('.collapsed').delay(1).show();
  
   document.getElementById('contract_option').style.display = 'block';
   document.getElementById('expand_option').style.display = 'none';
   return false;
}
function contractFairs(fairIDs)
{
   for (fairID in fairIDs) {
      var fairSection = document.getElementById('fairSection['+ fairIDs[fairID] +']');
      fairSection.style.display = 'none';
      var arrowImage = document.images['arrowImage['+fairIDs[fairID]+']'];
      arrowImage.src = rightArrowImage.src;
   }
   //$('.collapsed').delay(1).hide();
   document.getElementById('contract_option').style.display = 'none';
   document.getElementById('expand_option').style.display = 'block';
   return false;
}

function expandFair(fairID)
{
   var fairSection = document.getElementById('fairSection['+ fairID +']');
   var arrowImage = document.images['arrowImage['+fairID+']'];

   if (fairSection.style.display == 'none') {
      fairSection.style.display = 'block';
      arrowImage.src = downArrowImage.src;
   } else {
      fairSection.style.display = 'none';
      arrowImage.src = rightArrowImage.src;
   }
}

// initialize ajax
var request = false;
try {
   request = new XMLHttpRequest();
} catch (trymicrosoft) {
   try {
      request = new ActiveXObject('Msxml2.XMLHTTP');
   } catch (othermicrosoft) {
      try {
         request = new ActiveXObject('Microsoft.XMLHTTP');
      } catch (failed) {
         request = false;
      }
   }
}

function addFavorite(fair_id)
{
   var checkbox = document.getElementById('favoriteCheckboxes['+ fair_id +']');

   // open a connection to the ajax script
   request.open('POST', 'participating-events-in-add-favorite.php', true);
   request.setRequestHeader('Content-Type', 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded');

   // send the request
   request.send('artist_id={$_SESSION[artist_id]}&fair_id='+ fair_id +'&checked='+ checkbox.checked);
   request.onreadystatechange = updatePage;
}

function updatePage() {
   if (request.readyState == 4 && request.status == 200) {
      // ajax script successfully ran
      var response = request.responseText;
   }
}

</script>

   <span id='contract_option' style='display:none'>

               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2763'>2013 Arts Festival Conference Public Portfolio Critique</a> - <em><b>Louisville, Kentucky</b></em></td>

         <div id='fairSection[2763]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Louisville, Kentucky - Central Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>9/1/13 Midnight EST</b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>10/8/13 - 10/8/13</b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p><br />
Share your artwork with the field! Educate yourself and your peers in the jury process!<br />
<br />
This application is for a mock-jury session at the fifth annual Arts Festival Conference, presented by ZAPP&reg; and WESTAF. The 2013 conference is Monday, October 7, and Tuesday, October 8, 2013 at the Seelbach Hilton in Louisville, Kentucky.<br />
<br />
<font color="#FF0000">Please note that this is not an application for a juried art festival. This application is to submit your artwork images for a session held at the 2013 Conference. By completing this application you consent and understand that your images may be displayed and may be discussed by a panel during a conference session. </font><br />
<br />
This session will utilize the projection technology provided by ZAPP&reg;. This is a great opportunity for artists to submit new bodies of work and see how their images appear in the ZAPP&reg; projected jury format. This is also a great opportunity for emerging artists to submit work for review.<br />
<br />
Artists in attendance at the conference will be given the first priority. If space permits, other applicant images may be included for discussion.<br />
</p>

            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>1/15/13 Midnight CST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>6/1/13 - 6/2/13 <span style='color:red'>Show Past</span></b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>Every year since 1948 the first full weekend in June brings tens of thousands of art enthusiasts to the Hyde Park neighborhood of Chicago, adjacent to the University of Chicago campus, for the 57th Street Art Fair. Artists from throughout the country gather to exhibit their original work in a unique outdoor setting and give collectors a chance to buy their wares. Although most exhibitors are returning artists, each year the Fair invites participation by a limited number of new artists whose work has been screened by a jury of art professionals.<br />
<br />
Artists new to the Fair are asked to complete an application to submit your work for consideration. Returning artists must submit a completed application to reserve a booth space.<br />
<br />
We look forward to hearing from you!</p>

      <tr>
         <td colspan='2'>
         <table width='100%'>
            <tr>
               <td align='left' ><a href='javascript:expandFair(2817)'><img name='arrowImage[2817]' src='/images/arrow_right.gif' border='0'></a></td>
               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2817'>ACRE Northeast 2014</a> - <em><b>Edison, New Jersey</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2817]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Edison, New Jersey - North East Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>8/31/13 Midnight EST</b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>8/12/14 - 8/14/14</b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>Wholesalecrafts.com&trade; is proud to announce its first annual American Craft Retailers Expo&trade; (ACRE&trade;) Northeast show, August 12 - 14, 2014 at the New Jersey Convention Center in Edison, NJ. Produced by Wholesalecrafts.com&trade; and benchmarked off the growing success of its shows in Las Vegas and Orlando, ACRE&trade; Northeast now brings a third show offering per year to the Wholesalecrafts.com&trade; roster of services. Founded and privately owned by Nancy Vince since 1998, Wholesalecrafts.com&trade; is the leading online service for retailers to source American and Canadian wholesale artists. Currently boasting 1,200 artists and 15,000 retailer members, Wholesalecrafts.com&trade; is the only successful &ldquo;online trade show&rdquo; of its kind.&nbsp;<br />
<br />
ACRE&trade; Northeast is truly the latest revolution in wholesale shows for summer buying in this region. Just as artists and buyers have come to expect from ACRE&trade; Las Vegas in the West and ACRE&trade; Orlando in the East, ACRE&trade; Northeast will feature hundreds of juried wholesale artists among seven distinct juried showcases - Handmade Jewelry, Handmade Gifts &amp; Accessories, The Gallery of Fine Crafts, High Design Jewelry, Handmade Wearable Art, and One-of-a-Kind, with Emerging Artists who are brand new to trade shows, sprinkled throughout. The Gallery of Fine Crafts and High Design Jewelry spotlight handmade items that mostly wholesale at price points of $100 and above for fine craft and $80 and above for jewelry. Within these two showcases retailers will find a broad spectrum of jewelry incorporating precious and semi-precious metals and gemstones, furniture, home decor, garden accessories, and more, with high levels of creative design. The One-of-a-Kind showcase is by invitation only and features products mostly in the $500 price point and above. Rounding out the show is the Retailer Resource area, which will offer a collection of services and products such as imprinted bags, lighted display stands, industry publications and organizations.&nbsp;<br />
<br />
All three ACRE&trade; shows offer an all-inclusive booth package for American and Canadian wholesale artists to display their products, and provide an affordable venue for new artists to make their wholesale debut through its Emerging Artist program. In turn, retailers will find new, creative, and never-before-seen product lines each year at ACRE&trade;. Markets represented at ACRE&trade; include clothing and fashion accessories, tabletop, stationery, home furnishings and decorative accessories, garden accessories, pet products, toys, gifts, body and aromatics, jewelry, Judaica, &lsquo;green&rsquo; products, and more.&nbsp;<br />
<br />
ACRE&trade; Northeast will be heavily marketed using a strategic mix of direct mail, email, telephone contact, and print ads. Our aggressive marketing campaign will target both buyers and artists through industry publications and Wholesalecrafts.com&trade;&rsquo;s quarterly printed Buyer&rsquo;s Guide with a distribution of over 30,000 recipients carefully selected for compatibility with the handcrafted marketplace.&nbsp;<br />
<br />
ACRE&trade; artist applicants are juried online by a carefully selected panel of artist peers, Wholesalecrafts.com&trade; staff, and prominent retailers located throughout the United States. Applicants are screened for quality, craftsmanship, originality, and image presentation. Each accepted ACRE&trade; artist exhibitor receives one free year of Wholesalecrafts.com&trade; web service, where buyers can find artists online before, during and after the show.&nbsp;<br />
<br />
By using the latest web technologies, ACRE&trade; provides unprecedented pre-show planning opportunities and a host of educational and business support programs for both artists and retailers alike. The Craft Retailers&rsquo; Association for Tomorrow (C.R.A.F.T.) remains partnered with ACRE&trade; to offer onsite educational opportunities for retailers during the show. Presented by a panel of expert business owners and strategists, formats will include interactive classroom seminars, round table discussions, and private consultations. Most educational opportunities are complimentary with advance registration recommended.&nbsp;<br />
</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2817' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>
         </div>
         </td>
      </tr>

            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2819]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Edison, New Jersey - North East Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>8/31/13 Midnight EST</b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>8/12/14 - 8/14/14</b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>Wholesalecrafts.com&trade; is proud to announce its first annual American Craft Retailers Expo&trade; (ACRE&trade;) Northeast show, August 12 - 14, 2014 at the New Jersey Convention Center in Edison, NJ. Produced by Wholesalecrafts.com&trade; and benchmarked off the growing success of its shows in Las Vegas and Orlando, ACRE&trade; Northeast now brings a third show offering per year to the Wholesalecrafts.com&trade; roster of services. Founded and privately owned by Nancy Vince since 1998, Wholesalecrafts.com&trade; is the leading online service for retailers to source American and Canadian wholesale artists. Currently boasting 1,200 artists and 15,000 retailer members, Wholesalecrafts.com&trade; is the only successful &ldquo;online trade show&rdquo; of its kind.&nbsp;<br />
<br />
ACRE&trade; Northeast is truly the latest revolution in wholesale shows for summer buying in this region. Just as artists and buyers have come to expect from ACRE&trade; Las Vegas in the West and ACRE&trade; Orlando in the East, ACRE&trade; Northeast will feature hundreds of juried wholesale artists among seven distinct juried showcases - Handmade Jewelry, Handmade Gifts &amp; Accessories, The Gallery of Fine Crafts, High Design Jewelry, Handmade Wearable Art, and One-of-a-Kind, with Emerging Artists who are brand new to trade shows, sprinkled throughout. The Gallery of Fine Crafts and High Design Jewelry spotlight handmade items that mostly wholesale at price points of $100 and above for fine craft and $80 and above for jewelry. Within these two showcases retailers will find a broad spectrum of jewelry incorporating precious and semi-precious metals and gemstones, furniture, home decor, garden accessories, and more, with high levels of creative design. The One-of-a-Kind showcase is by invitation only and features products mostly in the $500 price point and above. Rounding out the show is the Retailer Resource area, which will offer a collection of services and products such as imprinted bags, lighted display stands, industry publications and organizations.&nbsp;<br />
<br />
All three ACRE&trade; shows offer an all-inclusive booth package for American and Canadian wholesale artists to display their products, and provide an affordable venue for new artists to make their wholesale debut through its Emerging Artist program. In turn, retailers will find new, creative, and never-before-seen product lines each year at ACRE&trade;. Markets represented at ACRE&trade; include clothing and fashion accessories, tabletop, stationery, home furnishings and decorative accessories, garden accessories, pet products, toys, gifts, body and aromatics, jewelry, Judaica, &lsquo;green&rsquo; products, and more.&nbsp;<br />
<br />
ACRE&trade; Northeast will be heavily marketed using a strategic mix of direct mail, email, telephone contact, and print ads. Our aggressive marketing campaign will target both buyers and artists through industry publications and Wholesalecrafts.com&trade;&rsquo;s quarterly printed Buyer&rsquo;s Guide with a distribution of over 30,000 recipients carefully selected for compatibility with the handcrafted marketplace.&nbsp;<br />
<br />
ACRE&trade; artist applicants are juried online by a carefully selected panel of artist peers, Wholesalecrafts.com&trade; staff, and prominent retailers located throughout the United States. Applicants are screened for quality, craftsmanship, originality, and image presentation. Each accepted ACRE&trade; artist exhibitor receives one free year of Wholesalecrafts.com&trade; web service, where buyers can find artists online before, during and after the show.&nbsp;<br />
<br />
By using the latest web technologies, ACRE&trade; provides unprecedented pre-show planning opportunities and a host of educational and business support programs for both artists and retailers alike. The Craft Retailers&rsquo; Association for Tomorrow (C.R.A.F.T.) remains partnered with ACRE&trade; to offer onsite educational opportunities for retailers during the show. Presented by a panel of expert business owners and strategists, formats will include interactive classroom seminars, round table discussions, and private consultations. Most educational opportunities are complimentary with advance registration recommended.&nbsp;<br />
</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2819' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>
         </div>
         </td>
      </tr>

            <p>Continuing with tradition, the Alden B. Dow Museum of Science &amp; Art is pleased to present the annual Holiday Art Fair, held indoors at Midland Center for the Arts. The Center is transformed into a holiday festival with approximately 100 artists&#39; booths, a Sweet Shop offering fresh-baked treats, local entertainment and Museum School faculty demonstrations.<br />
The Alden B. Dow Museum is in its 56th year as a visual arts organization and has made the Holiday Art Fair a tradition in the Midland community. The city is home to the world headquarters of The Dow Chemical Company and Dow Corning Corporation. Its population is augmented by educated and affluent corporate professionals, four regional colleges and a diverse range of citizens.<br />
Proceeds from the fair benefit museum art and science exhibitions, art and science classes, workshops, outreach and other educational programs of the Alden B. Dow Museum, a nonprofit organization. Our mission is to provide a forum to engage the people of mid-Michigan in the constructive and creative expressions found in science and in art.</p>

This event is quickly developing a reputation of being a great example of an artist-run show, with the festival website showcasing all of the participating artists with images, short descriptions and links to each artist&#39;s own website.                <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2363'>American Crafts Festival at Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts - 37th Annual 2013</a> - <em><b>New York, New York</b></em></td>

         <div id='fairSection[2363]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            New York, New York - North East Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>4/18/13 Midnight EST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>6/8/13 - 6/16/13 <span style='color:red'>Show Past</span></b><br>

            <p>Opportunities still available however not in Jewelry.<br />
The 37th Annual American Crafts Festival takes place at Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts, one of the most prestigious arts centers in the world. That association has always connoted the highest level of craftsmanship which attracts, year after year, a very large, astute, and enthusiastic audience capable of supporting beautiful work at all price points.<br />
<br />
The show takes place on two consecutive weekends, <strong>June 8,9 and June 15, 16, 2013.</strong> You can apply to either or both weekends.<br />
<br />
The Annual American Crafts Festivals at Lincoln Center traditionally host over 100,000 visitors each and are consistently the best crafts festivals in the New York City and tri-state metropolitan area. In addition to robust sales, often-exceeding $15,000 per weekend per capita, significant wholesale purchases have also been made at this event. Record sales due to visitors from the entire Megalopolis have made this the event of choice in the New York Area. New Yorkers, suburbanites, tourists and theater constituents all contribute to these banner sales. In addition, presents for weddings, graduation and Father&#39;s Day are timely contributions.<br />
<br />
<br />
</p>

      <tr>
         <td colspan='2'>
         <table width='100%'>
            <tr>
               <td align='left' ><a href='javascript:expandFair(2333)'><img name='arrowImage[2333]' src='/images/arrow_right.gif' border='0'></a></td>
               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2333'>Ann Arbor Street Art Fair, the Original 2013 </a> - <em><b>Ann Arbor, Michigan</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2333]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Ann Arbor, Michigan - North East Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>4/17/13 Midnight EST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>7/17/13 - 7/20/13 <span style='color:red'>Show Past</span></b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p><strong>NEW ART, NEW ARTIST- College Student Program</strong><br />
The New Art New Artist (NANA) Program features artwork from a select number of college artists who wish to establish themselves in a professional visual arts career. NANA allows you to be part of a major national art fair showcasing and selling your work in a shared booth, free of cost.&nbsp; Gain huge artistic exposure and experience as a fine arts entrepreneur.<br />
<br />
<strong>THE ANN ARBOR STREET ART FAIR, THE ORIGINAL- currently closed</strong><br />
The Ann Arbor Street Art Fair is the original of a collective of four concurrent and contiguous fairs that transform central Ann Arbor into a massive outdoor art gallery each July. Established in 1960 and still true to its mission of increasing public knowledge and appreciation for contemporary fine arts and fine crafts, the Original Ann Arbor Art Fair presents consistently high quality, all original work. Located on the streets surrounding the historic Burton Carillon Tower and the tree-lined central campus of the University of Michigan, the Street Art Fair, the Original, does not host sidewalk sales, buy/sell vendors, or non-artist vendors. The Street Art Fair is the only Ann Arbor fair to be named to AmericanStyle&rsquo;s list of Top-Ten Art Fairs and is known for attracting collectors, corporate buyers, and gallery representatives. The combined Ann Arbor Art Fair draws more than 500,000 fairgoers from across the nation. Join us as we celebrate our 54th year of Originality in Ann Arbor!</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2333' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>
         </div>
         </td>
      </tr>

Thunderbird Artists proudly presents the 10th Annual Arizona Fine Art EXPO, a 10 week event, nestled in the most affluent, upscale area of Scottsdale &amp; Carefree (located 5 miles south of Carefree and 5 miles north of Loop 101.) The EXPO is the perfect platform for artists to create and sell their work.<br />
<br />
Patrons love watching artists working in studios, purchasing and/or commissioning artwork, eating at the caf&eacute;, wandering the artists&rsquo; marketplace and strolling the 2-acre sculpture garden, along with attending garden parties and other special events.<br />

The Arizona Fine Art EXPO will receive an extensive advertising campaign, including: &nbsp; &nbsp; television, magazines, newspapers, online calendars, press releases, radio, websites, direct mail postcards and more.</p>

            <p>Art @ The Domain - Austin 2nd Annual Spring show.<br />
<br />
This juried three day art festival features fine art and contemporary craft in 13 media categories.<br />
<br />
The Domain is Austin&#39;s premier shopping and entertainment venue with more than one million square feet of restaurants and luxury retailers such as Barneys, Tiffany and Neiman Marcus surrounded in a beautifully landscaped setting. The Domain includes luxury apartments as well as a Westin hotel and Aloft Hotel. The Domain is also a massive mixed-use development with commercial, office and residential in a contemporary setting.<br />
<br />
Art Austin @ The Domain is opening weekend for the spring Texas art show tour. Welcoming Austin artists as wall as artists traveling the Texas show circuit.<br />
<br />
Austin is always a vibrant city filled with music and culture. Art Austin @ The Domain will become a new Austin tradition showcasing the independent artist.<br />
<br />
Austin is known around the world for its music, but it&#39;s also a major center for high-tech industries. Apple, Intel, Hewlett-Packard and Google all have offices here. It&#39;s eclectic and diverse and Austinites have a reputation for being supportive of the arts and of independent businesses.<br />
<br />
We look forward to seeing you at Art Austin @ The Domain.</p>

This juried 2 day art festival features fine art and contemporary craft in 13 media categories.&nbsp; Being the second year for the fall show and the fourth art show at the venue; the word is out to art buyers and shoppers.&nbsp; We have seen attendance and artist&rsquo;s sales growing with each show .&nbsp; Austin is always a vibrant city filled with music and culture. Art @ The Domain is fast becoming a new Austin tradition showcasing the independent artist.<br />
	&nbsp;<br />

            Austin, Texas - Central Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>1/4/13 Midnight CST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>4/13/13 - 4/14/13 <span style='color:red'>Show Past</span></b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p><b>Place</b>: Downtown Austin, TX in the 2ND Street Retail and Shopping District<br />
<br />
<br />
<b>Time</b>: Saturday, April 13: 10 am-6 pm, Sunday, April 14: 11 am-6 pm<br />
<br />
<br />
<b>Admission</b>: Available at the door--$8 Adults, Children 12 and under free<br />
<br />
<br />
<b>Communication</b>: Mailing Address: Art Alliance Austin, PO Box 5705, Austin, TX 78763<br />
<br />
Phone: 512-458-6073<br />
<br />
Email: max@artallianceaustin.org<br />
<br />
Website: www.artallianceaustin.org<br />
<br />
<br />
<p>
	<b>WHY ART CITY AUSTIN?</b><br />
	Art City Austin Festival takes place in the heart of downtown Austin and in the 2ND Street Retail and Shopping District. In the past year alone, over 500 residential units have been added in downtown &ndash; and all are within 3 blocks of the festival site. This unprecedented growth in Austin has the city ranked as the 2nd fasted growing metro in the nation! Art City Austin: downtown&#39;s art festival takes advantage of this growth by positioning itself in the heart of it all. We invite you to meet your collectors in Austin!<br />
	<br />
	In excess of 25,000 art enthusiasts from the region and nation are expected at the 63rd annual Art City Austin Festival.<br />
	<br />
	<br />
	Art City Austin Festival is presented by Art Alliance Austin, a non-profit organization with a full time professional staff, Board of Directors and more than 800 community volunteers. Proceeds from the event provide funding for artist and community programs.</p>
</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2303' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>

               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2346'>Art Fair Jackson Hole August 2013</a> - <em><b>Jackson, Wyoming</b></em></td>

         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2346]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Jackson, Wyoming - North West Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>3/3/13 Midnight MST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>8/16/13 - 8/18/13 <span style='color:red'>Show Past</span></b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>Established in 1965, Art Fair Jackson Hole (previously known as the Mountain Artists Rendezvous) brings diverse forms of art to a community that is rich with western history. AFJH is a three-day event that takes place the third weekend of July and August each year. We pride ourselves in serving you, the artists. We have a devoted local following and continue to work closely with Wyoming Travel and Tourism and the Jackson Hole Chamber of Commerce to draw upon the million plus tourists that pass through this region every summer. We hope that you will join us under the shadow of the Tetons in our beautiful mountain town of Jackson Hole. We look forward to receiving your application for the 48th annual Art Fair Jackson Hole!</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2346' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>
         </div>
         </td>

We have a devoted local following and continue to work closely with Wyoming Travel and Tourism and the Jackson Hole Chamber of Commerce to draw upon the million plus tourists that pass through this region every summer. We hope that you will join us under the shadow of the Tetons in our beautiful mountain town of Jackson Hole. We look forward to receiving your application for the 48th annual Art Fair Jackson Hole!</p>

            <p><p>
	<strong><b><span style="font-family: 'Arial', 'sans-serif'; font-size: 10pt">PREMIER&nbsp;OF&nbsp;A&nbsp;NEW&nbsp;ART&nbsp;SHOW&nbsp;IN&nbsp;THE&nbsp;PRIME&nbsp;DALLAS&nbsp;LOCATION&nbsp;OF<br />
	KLYDE WARREN PARK</span></b><span style="font-family: 'Arial', 'sans-serif'; font-size: 10pt"><o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>
Fall for the Arts is a collaborative effort between CBS Radio, Klyde Warren Park, The 500 Inc., Dallas Arts District and Guidelive powered by <em>The Dallas Morning News</em>. Fall for the Arts is focused on celebrating all the arts and cultural institutions within the DFW Metroplex.&nbsp; It is a one-day event that is free for all to attend that will include art, music and dance performances on various stages in Klyde Warren Park.&nbsp; It will be heavily promoted on CBS Radio, Guidelive and <em>The Dallas Morning News</em>. CBS Radio has asked The 500 Inc., to provide a <strong>maximum of 50 artists</strong> to participate in this <strong>premier and prestigious</strong> inaugural event.&nbsp;&nbsp; <strong>ART IN THE PARK </strong>is the juried art show that is a central part&nbsp;of the Fall for the Arts celebration.</p>

         <td colspan='2'>
         <table width='100%'>
            <tr>
               <td align='left' ><a href='javascript:expandFair(2697)'><img name='arrowImage[2697]' src='/images/arrow_right.gif' border='0'></a></td>
               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2697'>Art in the Park | Garden City</a> - <em><b>Garden City, KS, Kansas</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2697]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Garden City, KS, Kansas - Central Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>7/20/13 Midnight CST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>9/21/13 - 9/21/13</b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>In it&#39;s 44th year at this location, <span style="color:#cc6600;"><em><strong>Art in the Park Garden City</strong></em></span> invites artists to exhibit in this juried fine art &amp; fine craft event September 21. Our festival, located next to downtown, is held in the city&#39;s grassy and tree lined central park. Our festival coincides with downtown&#39;s <em><strong><a href="http://www.downtowngc.com/"><span style="color:#ff0000;">FallFest</span></a></strong></em> along Main Street. A small city with big attraction, we are located in southwest Kansas and attract visitors from neighboring towns and cities hundreds of miles away. We are centrally located in the U.S. and easy access to Oklahoma, Texas, and Colorado.<br />
Total amount juried awards offered: $1,500.00 </p>

               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2607'>Art Show at the Fest, Kansas City Irish Festival 2013</a> - <em><b>Kansas City, Missouri</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2607]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Kansas City, Missouri - Central Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>6/1/13 Midnight CST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>After another very successful year, the Kansas City Irish Festival is happy to continue their annual Art in the Park addition to their celebration of Celtic pride. Fifty artisans will be showcased in the beautiful tree-lined Washington Park, adjacent to Crown Center Square and in the heart of Kansas City&rsquo;s burgeoning historical art district &ndash; the Crossroads. This year, the KC Irish Fest weekend corresponds with Kansas City&rsquo;s First Fridays &ndash; the first Friday of each month when the Crossroads Community&#39;s art galleries, studios, and restaurants open their doors to showcase local and national artists.<br />
<br />
The Kansas City Irish Festival, the fastest growing Irish festival in America, has an outstanding reputation among participants and visitors, attracting over 100,000 people annually. We showcase two dozen world class acts on five main stages, Irish heritage exhibits, fabulous traditional food, children&rsquo;s activities, and an Irish Marketplace. Two hotels on site sell out over 2000 hotel nights over the weekend. This juried festival is open to all emerging and established artists. Where we are looking to add to the cultural climate of a Celtic Festival, we are not limited to Celtic themed art.</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2607' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>

            <p>Art&amp;Air, has gained a well-deserved reputation for presenting high-quality art in a warm, friendly environment with knowledgeable patrons who really want to know the artists and their work. Working hard to place the artist front and center, Art&amp;Air is, according to Sunshine Artists Magazine, &ldquo;known around the show circuit for its unbelievable artist treatment.&rdquo; The 10th Annual Art&amp;Air Fair, scheduled June 7-9, 2013, will attract more than 110 artists and 25,000 visitors to a spacious, oak-shaded park setting in the heart of historic Webster Groves, Missouri, just 10 minutes west of Downtown St. Louis. Webster Groves is a charming community of 19th and early 20th century homes-- many listed on the National Register of Historic Places--nestled among beautiful parks, gardens, public art installations, antique stores, bistros and boutiques. Supported by the Webster Community Arts Foundation, the Art&amp;Air Fair also features on-site food provided by favorite local restaurants, non-stop live music performances, and creative activities that draw visitors and buyers.<br />
<br />
Art&amp;Air provides $7,500 in artist awards. For more information, see www.artandair.com.</p>

               <td align='left' ><a href='javascript:expandFair(2279)'><img name='arrowImage[2279]' src='/images/arrow_right.gif' border='0'></a></td>
               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2279'>Arts Fair on the Square - Bloomington, IN 2013</a> - <em><b>Bloomington, Indiana</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2279]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Bloomington, Indiana - Central Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>4/1/13 Midnight EST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>6/22/13 - 6/22/13 <span style='color:red'>Show Past</span></b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>The Bloomington Playwrights Project&#39;s Arts Fair on the Square celebrates 33 years of bringing visual artists and craftspeople together with the local and regional buying community. This juried art show features over 80 regional and national artists and craftspeople on the picturesque grounds surrounding the Monroe County Courthouse. The mission of Arts Fair on the Square is to showcase fine art and craft of the highest quality, connect artists with the art-buying community and promote commitment to the arts through a variety of interactive arts experiences. For over thirty years, Arts Fair on the Square has been one of the premier annual events in Bloomington, Indiana, earning appreciation from artists from all over the country for its commitment to quality, great sales, and excellent exposure.</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2279' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>
         </div>
         </td>
      </tr>

            <p>Experience the 35th Arts Festival Oklahoma: Labor Day Weekend, August 31 - September 2, 2013! Art buyers from across Oklahoma and its surrounding states travel to Oklahoma City Community College every year to experience Oklahoma&#39;s premiere Labor Day weekend arts festival. Featuring over 150 artists from all over the country, daytime and headline main-stage entertainment, a Children&#39;s Creative Center, and a variety of food vendors, the state&#39;s largest fall arts festival draws over 25,000 visitors annually and averages $350,000 in art sales each year.</p>

Arts in the Square is hosted by Frisco Square Development with close participation of Collin County Songwriters Association and the Society for the Development of Visual Arts. Frisco Square hosts and presents events throughout the year and has a reputation of bringing out the high end buying crowd to each of its events.             Scranton, Pennsylvania - North East Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>5/1/13 Midnight EST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>6/8/13 - 6/9/13 <span style='color:red'>Show Past</span></b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>The 4th annual "Arts on Fire" will be held on Saturday, June 8th and Sunday, June 9th at the Historic Iron Furnaces in Scranton, PA. This exciting event has grown in popularity since its inception! Saturday will host an Iron Pour and Sunday industrial arts demonstrations. Bands will provide a lively background and a variety of food vendors will keep everyone happy both days!<br />
<br />
On Friday, June 7th, from 8 p.m. to 11 p.m., the Anthracite Heritage Museum and Iron Furnaces Associates will host a fundraising event on the site.  This will include music, a selection of Hors d'Oeuvres, desserts, wine, beer and refreshments.  The cost for art vendors is $15, per person, in advance.  Proceeds benefit the Anthracite Heritage Museum and Iron Furnaces Associates, a non-profit membership organization.  Artists may request an exhibition space reservation for this Friday night event and consider it a "preview party" for guests.  If you wish to explore this option you must call Chester Kulesa or Edward D'Amico at (570) 963-4804 or Jared Jaffe at (570) 945-8463 by May 1, 2013.<br />
<br />
</p>

               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2692'>Arts Round-Up 2013</a> - <em><b>Spicewood, Texas</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>

         <div id='fairSection[2692]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Spicewood, Texas - South West Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>6/19/13 Midnight CST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>10/19/13 - 10/20/13</b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>
<p>
	The Spicewood Arts Society is sponsoring <b>Arts Round-Up </b> 2013, a fine art festival, on October 19-20, 2013 in Spicewood, Texas.</p>
This is the tenth year for the Arts Round-Up and has become a popular show with artists and guests alike. The fine art festival will be held on the grounds of LaCabana Grill on TX Hwy 71. The beautiful oak grove has picnic tables, attractive plantings, a water fountain, a children&#39;s play area, a covered outdoor food service area and of course the restaurant itself. Spicewood is a rapidly growing area situated just west of Austin and conveniently central to Johnson City, Marble Falls, Lakeway, and Bee Caves. In addition to its easy access from the very busy Hwy 71, this location is very near to large and growing upscale housing areas.<br />
<br />
Central Texas artists working in all 2D and 3D media are encouraged to apply for this very cost effective show. Spicewood Arts Society is an all volunteer, non-profit organization dedicated to supporting the visual, performing and literary arts in the Spicewood Community. As such we want to bring excellent art to the community and to support our artists. <a href="mailto:visualarts@spicewoodarts.org">Email</a> , web site: <a href="”http://www.SpicewoodArts.org”" target="”_blank”">www.SpicewoodArts.org</a><br />
</p>

<strong>For one weekend in March, Downtown Stuart comes alive with the arts as the 27th Annual ArtsFest arrives to showcase creativity of all kinds. Guests are invited to admire the fine art and craft exhibitors, entertain the young ones with hands-on arts activities, sip a glass of wine or micro-brewed beer and sit back and relax while enjoying some of the area&rsquo;s best performing artists. &nbsp;&nbsp;2014 marks the City of Stuart&rsquo;s centennial, and to pay tribute to this historic event, ArtsFest will be celebrating the Centennial all weekend long. </strong><br />
<strong>ArtsFest features an even array of Jewelry, Painting, Photography, Ceramics, Drawing, Mixed-Media, as well as Glass, Fiber Art, Wood and Sculpture; the best in the area of Fine Arts and Fine Crafts.&nbsp;&nbsp; Mark your calendars now: March 15 and 16, 2014, with extended hours on Saturday 10 am to 7 pm and Sunday 10 am to 5 pm.&nbsp; Admission is only $5 per person (children 12 and under are free).&nbsp; </strong><br />

            <p><div>
	 </div>
<div>
	This 2nd year fine art festival features juried fine artists from across the country. Seasoned show promoter is organized & attuned to artist needs.<br />
	<br />
	Held around the gazebo in a life-style center, there are, on average, 40,000 visitors to the center every weekend! Artists reported high sales, easy load in and out, excellent customer service and artist amenities.<br />
	<br />
	D & W Events is an 11 year old fine art festival management company with proven success measured by the percentage of return artists and customer base.  <br />
	<br />
	We recognize that the Chicago area is inundated with art festivals, many of the same artists present at the majority of them.  We travel worldwide to find unique, RAW and emerging artists that subsequently make our festivals stand out from others.  Our advertising campaign attracts curent and future art lovers aka "the buying crowd".<br />
	<br />
	<ul><li>Jury fee is $45</li><br />
	<li>Booth fee (10x10) is $300</li><br />
	<li>Drive to your space</li><br />
	<li>Free day and overnight parking</li><br />
	<li>Outstanding artist amenities</li><br />
	<li>Early set up and artist preview party<br />
	on Friday.</li><br />
	<li>Free admission<br />
	<br />
	Festival hours are Saturday, 10 - 5 and Sunday, 11 - 5<br />
	<br />
	Contact D & W Events, <a href="http://www.dwevents.org">dwevents.org</a> or <a href="tel:847-726-8669">847-726-8669</a> for more information.</li></ul></div>

<br />
Demographics are unrivaled anywhere in the nation.&nbsp; From 2005 to 2011 Loudoun County&rsquo;s population grew by 60% from an influx of highly-educated people. The median home value is over $450,000 and the median household income (MHI) of $120,100 is the highest in the nation.<br />

            <p>Autumn &amp; Art at Bradley Fair is south central Kansas&rsquo; premier small art show. Held during the most beautiful time of year in Kansas, September 13-15, 2013, the show is located in a dynamic shopping, office and upscale residential area in northeast Wichita, Bradley Fair. Artist booths are set along Bradley Fair Parkway, adjacent to a beautifully manicured and landscaped lake within easy walking distance from one end to the other, creating a peaceful, relaxed atmosphere. The venue provides easy load-in and load-out for artists and their vehicles.<br />
<br />
A $100,000+ targeted advertising campaign supports the show - utilizing television, radio, billboards, newspaper, magazine and web site media. Approximately 15,000 people attended in 2012.<br />
<br />
The weekend begins with an invitation-only Patron Party on Friday evening, giving discerning buyers the opportunity to explore show offerings prior to the general public. Saturday and Sunday the show is free to the public and open 10 am to 7 pm on Saturday and 10 am to 5 pm on Sunday. Kansas hospitality is reflected in the helpful volunteers and staff on-site to assist artists throughout the weekend.<br />
<br />
In its fourth year, Autumn &amp; Art is a one-of-a-kind event in Wichita. The goal is to establish a small, high quality art show that will provide a diverse array of art options for both collectors and art enthusiasts.</p>

The overwhelmingly successful Autumn Crafts Festival at Lincoln Center is back!<br />
With the American Crafts Festival at Lincoln Center, it is one of the two premier craft marketing events in the New York Metro area. The 24th Annual Autumn Crafts Festival takes place at Lincoln<br />
Center for the Performing Arts, the most prestigious arts centers in the world. That association has always connoted the highest level of craftsmanship which attracts, year after year, a very large, astute, and enthusiastic audience capable of supporting beautiful work at all price points.<br />
<br />
<br />
The show takes place on two consecutive weekends,<strong> October 5,6 and October 12,13, 2013.</strong> You can apply to either or both weekends.<br />
<br />
<br />
The annual Crafts Festivals at Lincoln Center traditionally host over 100,000 visitors each and are consistently the best crafts festivals in the New York City and tri-state metropolitan area. In addition to robust sales, often-exceeding $8,000 per weekend per capita, significant wholesale purchases have also been made at those events. Record sales due to visitors from the entire Megalopolis have made the Autumn Crafts Festival at Lincoln Center the event of choice, in the autumn, in the New York Area. New Yorkers, suburbanites, tourists and theater constituents all contribute to its banner sales. In addition, presents for the winter holiday season are timely contributions.<br />
<br />
<br />
In addition to our own enormous mailing list of metropolitan area qualified crafts customers, there are thousands of theatre goers that afford expensive tickets, tourists from all over the world who come to Lincoln Center, a tourist must see destination and buy an abundance of unique American crafts. All of this is in a neighborhood where apartments cost millions of dollars.<br />
<br />
The number of participants in each craft area will be carefully balanced so as to afford all participants their fair share of this abundantly rich market.</p>

            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>Handmade + High-End. Join over 300 national artists at the most prestigious art, craft and design festival in the Pacific Northwest for over 60 years. BAM ARTSfair (July 26-28, 2013) is your opportunity to extend your reach to one of the most affluent areas in the country and connect with hundreds of thousands of art enthusiasts. <br />
<br />
Submissions are due by Friday, January 18, 2013 ($40 application fee). Booth fees range from $815 - $1215 depending on size and location. <br />
<br />
BAM ARTSfair is one of few art fairs in the world produced by a museum. Submissions are reviewed by three independent jurors, all of whom possess a deep understanding and knowledge of contemporary art. Artists are scored via www.zapplication.org with 315 artists being ultimately invited to participate in the 2013 BAM ARTSfair.</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2318' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>

            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>Welcome to the Berkshire Crafts Fair. This will be our 38th year. The Berkshire Crafts Fair is a juried fair and features a wide range of contemporary and traditional crafts. Over the years the Berkshire Crafts Fair has developed a reputation as a high quality, well-run show. Our show is located in a nationally known tourist area and is nearby Tanglewood, the summer home of the world-famous Boston Symphony Orchestra.</p>

         <td colspan='2'>
         <table width='100%'>
            <tr>
               <td align='left' ><a href='javascript:expandFair(2441)'><img name='arrowImage[2441]' src='/images/arrow_right.gif' border='0'></a></td>
               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2441'>BERKSHIRES ARTS FESTIVAL | JULY 4•5•6 & JULY 12•13•14 </a> - <em><b>Great Barrington, Massachusetts</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2441]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Great Barrington, Massachusetts - North East Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>6/30/13 Midnight EST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>7/4/13 - 7/14/13 <span style='color:red'>Show Past</span></b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p><b><font color="#9b1010">JULY 4&bull;5&bull;6 CLOSED&nbsp;</font></b><b><font color="#9b1010">BERKSHIRES ARTS FESTIVAL&nbsp;</font></b><br />
<br />
<b>&nbsp;</b><b><font color="#9b1010">JULY 12&bull;13&bull;14&nbsp;</font></b><b>Applications still being considered<br />
&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; (Subject to availability.</b><strong> Closed to Jewelry)</strong><br />
<br />
The Berkshires Arts Festival has become a Berkshire tradition attracting thousands of art lovers who come to the Berkshires for theater, dance, music, and art.<br />
Founded by Richard and Joanna Rothbard, owners of An American Craftsman Galleries, the Berkshires Arts Festival attracts top artists from all across the USA and Canada.<br />
Most cultural events such as Tanglewood, Jacob&#39;s Pillow, and Berkshire Theatre Festival take place in the evening and our Berkshire Festival has become the chosen daytime, weekend attraction. Artists from across the country have discovered that this show has the potential to produce great sales, and that there is a strong customer base for higher priced work.<br />
The Berkshires Arts Festival continues to thrive as one of the brightest small art fairs in the country.<br />
<br />
<br />
<br />
&bull; 200 Exhibitors<br />
&bull; Indoor, outdoor and tented Booths avail<br />
&bull; Beautiful mountain setting<br />
&bull; Unload directly at booth<br />
&bull; Camping on site<br />
&bull; Online Artist Directory with link to artist&#39;s website
<p>
	<br />
	The Berkshires is comprised of 30 unique towns and 2 cities bordering Vermont, New York and Connecticut and is equidistant from Boston and New York City.<br />
	2.5 million visitors travel to the Berkshires each year to immerse themselves in the various cultural events from art, to music, theatre and dance.<br />
	<br />
	<b>After 12 years of our highly successful Berkshires Arts Festival on July 4th weekend, we are adding a second weekend which will cater to thousands of new visitors who visit the Berkshires throughout the summer season as well as to many of the locals who are out of town over the 4th of July holiday.</b><br />
	<br />
	Exhibitors who participate in both weekends will be allowed to leave their booths set up in place between the weekends.</p>
</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2441' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>
         </div>

         <div id='fairSection[2503]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Seattle, Washington - North West Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>8/22/13 Midnight PST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            <p><p style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 12.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">
	The 25th annual <b><i>Best of the Northwest FALL Art &amp; Fine Craft Show</i></b> has changed venue and will be held in historic Hangar 30 at Warren G. Magnuson Park in Seattle.The show is presented in 2 great acts. &nbsp;</p>
<p style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 12.0px 0.0px; text-align: center; font: 17.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">
	Act 1<span class="Apple-tab-span" style="white-space:pre"> </span>October 18, 19, 20</p>
<p style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 12.0px 0.0px; text-align: center; font: 17.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">
	Act 2<span class="Apple-tab-span" style="white-space:pre"> </span>November 8, 9, 10</p>
<p style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 12.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">
	Each act will feature 108 cast members for a total of 216 of the region&#39;s best artists and craftspeople.&nbsp; Our homecoming to the hangar after a few years away has past Best of the Northwest participants and patrons very excited.&nbsp; This beautiful park is a local favorite with free parking and heavy foot traffic. &nbsp;</p>
<p style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 12.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">
	<b>ARTIST AMENITIES:</b></p>
<ul style="list-style-type: disc"><li style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">No commission (artists keep all sales revenue)</li><li style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">Easy load-in on Thursday from noon to 8:00PM</li><li style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">Booth Sitting</li><li style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">Artist Lounge</li><li style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">Overnight Security</li><li style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">Free Parking</li><li style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">Free Passes for your best customers</li><li style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">Free Postcards for your marketing efforts</li></ul>
<p style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323; min-height: 14.0px">
	&nbsp;</p>
<p style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 12.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">
	Join us for either event in the light-filled, <span style="text-decoration: underline">newly renovated and updated historic airplane hangar</span> with live entertainment from local musicians and a great community of your fellow artisans!</p>
<p style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 12.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323; min-height: 14.0px">
	&nbsp;</p>
<p style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 12.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">
	<b>LIMITED REOPENING</b></p>
<p style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 12.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">
	As a result of the overwhelming response of our artists to date, only Act 1 - the OCTOBER event - will be reopening in selected categories by August 15th, 2013.</p>
<p style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 12.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">
	Your application fee, with acceptable jury scores, entitles you to a listing in the juried members&#39; gallery with your website link on the Northwest Art Alliance website, plus other member benefits for 1 year, even if there isn&#39;t space for you in the show.</p>
<p style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 12.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">
	<b>Please note:</b></p>
<p style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 12.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">
	Artists who have been accepted to the November show cannot apply to the October show.&nbsp;</p>
<p style="margin: 0.0px 0.0px 12.0px 0.0px; font: 12.0px Helvetica; color: #232323">
	Artists who are sharing a booth in the November show cannot apply to the October show.&nbsp;</p>

            <p>Artists, craftspeople and designers please join us for this perennial favorite annual spring Best of the Northwest art &amp; fine craft show. Best of the Northwest spring show will be held in an upscale venue on the Seattle waterfront and will feature 150 top quality artists, wonderful live music, wine and food. Since the Smith Cove Cruise Terminal at Pier 91 was created to serve the cruising community, the facility is gorgeous and has spectacular views of the sound. The cultural event is under one roof with all booths and activities accessible to all patrons. This venue has been home to our large fall shows for three years and, for the spring show, we will scale the facility back using just the foyer and the top floor to create a more intimate event.<br />
<br />
<strong>NOTE: We have a couple spaces available in all categories except JEWELRY &amp; PHOTOGRAPHY.<br />
<br />
If you are a JEWELER or PHOTOGRAPHER please do not apply.</strong></p>

               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2466'>Bethesda Row Arts Festival 2013</a> - <em><b>Bethesda , Maryland</b></em></td>

         <div id='fairSection[2466]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Bethesda , Maryland - North East Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>5/31/13 Midnight EST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>10/19/13 - 10/20/13</b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>Each October, the streets of Bethesda Row, are turned into an outdoor art gallery, featuring juried fine arts and fine crafts. 190 leading artists nationwide come to Bethesda, MD&#39;s Arts and Entertainment District to showcase their work. Sunshine Artist Magazine has recognized the Festival as one of the top fine arts shows in the United States. This two-day event attracts over 45,000 art patrons.<br />
<br />
Additionally, the Arts Festival offers an Art Sale benefitting the NIH Children&#39;s Charities, children&#39;s art activities, live acoustic stage performances and high-quality outdoor food vendors. Bethesda Row features more than 50 fine shops, upscale galleries and unique restaurants with outdoor seating.

      <tr>
         <td colspan='2'>
         <table width='100%'>
            <tr>
               <td align='left' ><a href='javascript:expandFair(2389)'><img name='arrowImage[2389]' src='/images/arrow_right.gif' border='0'></a></td>
               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2389'>Boston Mills Artfest 2013</a> - <em><b>Peninsula, Ohio</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2389]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Peninsula, Ohio -  Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>2/7/13 Midnight EST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>6/28/13 - 7/7/13 <span style='color:red'>Show Past</span></b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>The Boston Mills Artfest is a nationally recognized fine art and fine craft show. 2013 marks the 42nd consecutive year that the Artfest will be held Rain or Shine at Boston Mills Ski Resort, nestled in the scenic Cuyahoga Valley National Park midway between Cleveland and Akron.<br />
<br />
As a professional artist, why should the Boston Mills Artfest be on your summer schedule? First and foremost, because Boston Mills is committed to putting on a high-quality art show every year, and we understand that great shows are made up of two components: talented artists, and savvy patrons. We strive to attract both.<br />
<br />
Positive word-of-mouth from satisfied customers is our best publicity, of course, but we work tirelessly and year-round to publicize the Artfest. More than 50,000 postcards are sent out to households who have visited the Artfest in previous years, or are in locations with our targeted demographics. Cleveland Magazine prints the show programs and inserts copies into their June issue for distribution. Boston Mills also cultivates media and corporate partnerships to maximize the dollars we put into each year&#39;s advertising on a mix of billboards, print, and radio.<br />
<br />
Ron Beahn, a local working artist with many years of experience in art show promotion, serves as the Boston Mills Artfest Director and helps us to keep our show very artist-friendly. From the Artist Dinner before the show&#39;s Preview to the daily newsletters, food discounts, and open communication lines, we strive to make doing our show as easy as possible for all of our Exhibitors.<br />
<br />
The Boston Mills Artfest consists of two separate shows on consecutive weekends. For 2013, the first weekend will be June 28th-30th and the second weekend will be July 5th-7th.<br />
<br />
Deadline for applications for the 2013 Boston Mills Artfest has been extended to February 7, 2013.</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2389' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>
         </div>

            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>The Buyers Market returns to Philadelphia for its 32nd annual winter show. The nation&#39;s largest wholesale tradeshow for contemporary craft artists from the U.S. and Canada.&nbsp;<br />
<div>
	<br />
	<strong>NEW DATES</strong>: Saturday, January 18, 2014 - Tuesday, January 21, 2014</div>
<div style="margin-left: 80px;">
	(Jewelry Section Preview: Friday, January 17, 4-7pm)</div>
<br />
<p>
	<b>Exhibitors</b></p>
<p>
	Approximately 800-1,000 companies participate each year. They are primarily small studio artists in all media. Exhibitors display samples of their work and write orders for future production with qualified wholesale buyers.&nbsp;</p>
<p>
	<b>Attendees</b></p>
<p>
	Between 4,000-6,000 representing about 2,000 companies. Attending buyers include craft galleries, museum shops, specialty retailers, catalogs, gift stores, boutiques, jewelry stores, judaica shops and art galleries.&nbsp;<br />
	<br />
	The Buyers Market is open to the trade only. Attending buyers must present credentials supporting intent to purchase wholesale.<br />
	<br />
	<strong>Venue</strong><br />
	<br />
	The Buyers Market is held in the all-new wing of the Pennsylvania Convention Center in Philadelphia. The Center&#39;s convenient downtown location is walkable to all our participating hotels and the city&#39;s excellent restaurants and nightlife.<br />
	<br />
	The show floor is divided by medium. Choose to exhibit in one of the following sections:</p>
<ul><li>Glass &amp; Ceramics</li><li>Mixed Media</li><li>Wearable Fiber &amp; Accessories</li><li>Jewelry</li><li>Premier Jewelry (gold, platinum &amp; precious gems)</li><li>Suppliers</li><li>New: Featured aisle of all new exhibitors</li></ul></p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2775' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>
         </div>
         </td>

            <p><strong>Rio Grande Festivals presents a brand new show... in central Denver!</strong> &nbsp;The inaugural Cheesman Park Art Fest welcomes artists and craftsmen to apply for this juried, two-day outdoor festival in one of Denver&#39;s prized historic parks. &nbsp;The show will take place on the southern side of Cheesman&#39;s 80 acre greenscape, with maximum visibility to 8th Avenue. &nbsp;The demographics and location of the park are prime for a show; with a population density 4 times the city average, and home prices nearly double the city average.<br />

         <td colspan='2'>
         <table width='100%'>
            <tr>
               <td align='left' ><a href='javascript:expandFair(2430)'><img name='arrowImage[2430]' src='/images/arrow_right.gif' border='0'></a></td>
               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2430'>Clara Brierly Festival of the Arts 2013</a> - <em><b>Peculiar, Missouri</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2430]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Peculiar, Missouri - Central Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>4/22/13 Midnight CST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>6/7/13 - 6/9/13 <span style='color:red'>Show Past</span></b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>Our festival is just like our town&#39;s name - one of a kind! The Clara Brierly Festival of the Arts (CBFOA) gives a nod to our history of Chautauqua in downtown Peculiar, Missouri (southern tip of the Kansas City Metro area). The event is named for local, outsider artist Clara Brierly. Our festival is a low key, friendlier paced event. The combination indoor/outdoor event is held in the shadow of the 1908, rock building which was formerly a Methodist church (with amazing, turn of the century stained glass windows) at 163 W. Center St., Peculiar, MO. The buildings and surrounding grounds are now the campus of the Downtown Peculiar Arts &amp; Culture District (DPACD); a 501(c)(3) not for profit organization dedicated to the revitalization of our Downtown as an arts district. The CBFOA is a key piece of our Downtown revitalization effort (we are a Missouri Main Street Connection Affiliate grantee, a member of the Missouri Association for Community Arts Agencies and a Missouri Arts Council Creative Community nominee). We are an all volunteer staff. Unlike some for profit festivals, we won&#39;t take your money and then leave you on your own! We spend the majority of the year working on this event (among others) and we do all we can to make it an experience you will enjoy, remember and return to each year. Per their post festival surveys, most of our artist vendors do as well at our festival with regard to sales as they do in the larger events held around us; we do believe this is due to increased &quot;face time&quot;. The Downtown Peculiar Arts &amp; Culture District (DPACD) gives out Purchase Awards as part of the festival. This year we are fortunate enough to have two, large draw, anchor acts who have committed to actively partner with us to attract crowds as well as numerous smaller draws throughout the weekend to pull constant foot traffic. If you have &quot;heART&quot;, you belong here.</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2430' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>
         </div>
         </td>

An excess of 10,000 regional and national art enthusiasts are expected again at the annual Festival of the Arts.  The event is FREE to the public and enriches the region’s cultural landscape by promoting participation in the Arts.  <br />
<br />
The 2013 Festival of the Arts event will again also create a wonderful plethora of live performances in music and dance in addition to exciting visual art exhibits. The Festival also features independent cinema/film, additional varieties of other live entertainment, educational family art activities, an art-full KidZone for those 12 and under and quality food and beverages for purchase. <br />
<br />
Corpus Christi Creative Connections, the business umbrella and 501c3 non profit corporation, hosts the annual Festival of the Arts with the support of the Downtown Management District, City of Corpus Christi, Texas Commission on the Arts, Coastal Bend Community Foundation and community volunteers who understand the benefits of having Art & Artists in their community.             <p>The Covington Three Rivers Art Festival invites you to apply to our 17th Annual juried festival. Attracting 50,000 visitors last year, the award-winning festival is dedicated to bringing the best of fine arts and fine crafts to historic downtown Covington, Louisiana, and providing the best in Southern Hospitality for our artists.<br />
<br />
Our site stretches outdoors along Columbia Street, lined by many of the galleries, antique and specialty shops, and restaurants for which Covington is well-known. The Arts Alive! demonstrations, Children&rsquo;s Discovery Area, Student Art Exhibit and musical performances add to the festival ambiance and attraction.<br />
<br />
Conveniently accessed off I-12, Covington is located on the Northshore of Lake Pontchartrain across the world&rsquo;s longest bridge, and is only 45 minutes from downtown New Orleans. This quaint, historic town is nestled along the Abita, Bogue Falaya and Tchefuncte Rivers&mdash;hence the name Covington Three Rivers Art Festival.<br />
<br />
Applications for this year&#39;s festival will be accepted and processed through ZAPPlicationTM beginning February 8, 2012. Deadline for accepting entries is June 4, 2012.</p>

         <div id='fairSection[2706]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            DeLand, Florida - South East Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>

            <p><strong>Application Deadline Extended to August 30th.</strong><br />
<br />
The DeLand Fall Festival of the Arts is an exciting, juried fine art show, celebrating it&#39;s <strong>21st year</strong>. The historic preservation district of downtown DeLand provides a charming backdrop for this annual festival which is dedicated to those who create as well as those who appreciate and collect art.<br />
<br />
Over <strong>$50,000 in awards</strong> is available in judging and purchase awards. More than <strong>50,000</strong> <strong>patrons</strong> enjoy the fine art exhibits presented by our juried artists of various mediums including painting, glass, sculpture, jewelry, leather, photography, printmaking, wood, ceramics, and fiber.<br />
<br />
The DeLand community continues to support the Festival and its Artists through a <strong>Patron / Collector Program.</strong> Festival Artist will have the opportunity to meet festival Patron /Collectors members at the Artist Check-in and Preview Event on Friday night before the festival weekend. Generous purchases by our Art Festival Patrons will add to sales and make this festival even more successful for you.<br />
<br />
<strong>Artist Amenities Include:</strong><ul><li>Artist Check-in and Preview Event on Friday night. The celebration typically attracts about 50,000 visitors over the course of the weekend.&nbsp;<br />
<br />
We invite artists and crafters who handmake their own items to apply, and are particularly interested in&nbsp;vendors with heritage crafts, holiday items and specialty gift items.&nbsp;All items must be handmade by the vendor and vendors are selected through a jury process.&nbsp; We will invite about 75 artists to participate.&nbsp; </p>

               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2260'>Downtown Silver Spring Fine Art Festival 2013</a> - <em><b>Silver Spring, Maryland</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2260]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Silver Spring, Maryland - North East Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>4/17/13 Midnight EST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>5/4/13 - 5/5/13 <span style='color:red'>Show Past</span></b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>The <strong>Downtown Silver Spring Fine Art Festival</strong> returns to Ellsworth Drive in the heart of downtown Silver Spring, MD.&nbsp; Located in Montgomery County, Silver Spring is a major business hub situated at the north apex of Washington, D.C.&nbsp;Ellsworth Drive typically draws 20,000 visitors on a non-event weekend in May.&nbsp; Proximity to the Washington DC markets and built-in local audience makes this an ideal location for a fine art festival. The Downtown Silver Spring shopping district features an eclectic mix of entertainment, restaurants, retail, offices and a brand new Courtyard by Marriott Hotel.&nbsp; &nbsp;<br />
<br />
Paragon has held four events in Downtown Silver Spring through 2012. The first event in 2011 placed in the Top 100 fine art festivals nationwide. At that time the event extended on Ellsworth Drive both east and west of the Fenton Street. We have decided to decrease the show to a maximum of 50 artists as we have seen an inconsistency in the crowds visiting the east and west sections of the show. Our national and corporate sponsorship is extremely strong in the Silver Spring market. Their support will continue to help underwrite this event which combined with the smaller size, will give artists a greater likelihood of success in this market.<br />
<br />
<span style="color:#0000ff;"><strong>2011 AVERAGE SALES: &nbsp;&nbsp;$2887 (AFSB)<br />
2012 AVERAGE SALES: &nbsp;&nbsp;$2149 (62 artists reporting)</strong></span></p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2260' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>
         </div>
         </td>

The inaugural year of the Fairfax Fine Art Festival (2011) produced a #44 national ranking.&nbsp; In 2012 the event may yet place in the Top 100 fine art festivals despite being hit&nbsp;with unseasonably cold (i.e., 48-degree) temperatures and a rain front that closed the show an hour early on Saturday.&nbsp; Although the show rebounded Sunday, weather effectively turned the festival into a one-day event.<br />

               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2574'>Fall Fest at the Hermitage 2013</a> - <em><b>Hermitage, Tennessee</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2574]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Hermitage, Tennessee - South East Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>8/15/13 Midnight CST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>10/4/13 - 10/6/13</b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>&ldquo;Fall Fest at The Hermitage&rdquo; is produced by the Hermitage, Home of President Andrew Jackson a non-profit organization. The Fall Fest at The Hermitage mission is to promote, advocate and support original visual art and artists.<br />
<br />
<div class="text_exposed_root text_exposed" id="id_5175f53bca5168c73763061">
	We are attempting to, create or set, a world&rsquo;s record and we would love for you to help.<br />
	<br />
	We are asking the community to paint boxes that will become the blocks of a wall that will be built at &ldquo;The Hermitage, Home of President Andrew Jackson&rdquo;, during their &ldquo;Fall Fest at the Hermitage&rdquo; next October 4-6, 2013. &ldquo;Fall Fest at the Hermitage&rdquo; will be an Art&rsquo;s &amp; Music Festival that will be held on the gr<span class="text_exposed_hide">...</span><span class="text_exposed_show">ounds of the Hermitage annually beginning next fall.<br />
	<br />
	The boxes that will be painted are 18&rdquo;x18&rdquo;x18&rdquo; and can be picked up at Picture This Creative Framing &amp; Gallery, 4674 Lebanon Pike in Hermitage. Everyone is encouraged to paint a box and anything can be painted on the box, the wall will be like a community quilt. Local Artist Myles Maillie will be overseeing the building of the wall during the festival and Matt Fischer of Picture This will be coordinating the painting of the boxes. Boxes are now available for pickup at Picture This and are $5.00 per box. The wall will be six feet tall and as long as we can make it.<br />
	<br />
	There are three ways you can participate.<br />
	1) Attend one of the &ldquo;Box Painting Parties&rdquo; at Picture This, paint will be provided. Picture This will hold your boxes until it is time to build the mural.<br />
	2) Stop by Picture This and pick up your boxes. Paint them at home and bring them back to Picture This to hold.<br />
	3) Attend the &ldquo;Fall Fest at The Hermitage&rdquo; and paint your boxes during the festival.<br />
	<br />
	Be sure to &ldquo;Like&rdquo; the &ldquo;Stacked Box Community Mural&rsquo;s&rdquo; Facebook page to keep up with our progress <a href="http://www.facebook.com/StackedBoxCommunityMuralProject" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">www.facebook.com/StackedBoxCommunityMuralProject</a>.<br />
	<br />
	For more information contact Matt at matt@picturethis-gallery.com. </span></div>
</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2574' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>
         </div>
         </td>
      </tr>

<br />
