            <p>October is Art Month in Georgetown with visual and performing art events hosted around the town, culminating the last weekend with Georgetown Art In Square. This charming juried art and craft festival features 100&nbsp;art booths offering patrons 2 full days of art buying.&nbsp; Along with the wonderful art in the festival, a children&rsquo;s art area, a performing arts stage and 2013 brings a new attraction, The Art of Wine &amp; Beer, on the Courthouse Square. &nbsp;Georgetown&rsquo;s Square is hailed the &ldquo;Most Beautiful Town Square In Texas&rdquo; and is a picturesque setting for the art show.&nbsp;&nbsp; Georgetown has ample free parking. &nbsp; We will be loading in on Friday. &nbsp;Artist who want to participate may be open on the square from 5-7 for &quot;Trick or Treating&quot; on the Square for Georgetown families. &nbsp; Many come out for this annual tradition and candy is supplied to retailers and artists to pass out to the kids. &nbsp;Will be an added selling opportunity but not mandatory to participate.<br />
&nbsp;<br />
Georgetown, Texas is just 26 miles North, up Highway 35 from Austin Texas; near the world headquarters of Dell Computer, and home to many who work in Austin. &nbsp;The Greater Austin area is a major center for high-tech industries. Apple, Intel, Hewlett-Packard, and Google with over 1.5 million residents and is considered one of the fastest growing areas in Texas. &nbsp;<br />
&nbsp;<br />
&nbsp;<br />
Georgetown Art In Square, is closing weekend for the Fall Texas art show tour. We welcome local, and regional artists as well as artists traveling the fall circuit wanting to add more Texas dates. &nbsp;&nbsp;Lynette Wallace Productions LLC presents Georgetown Art In The Square, Art @ The Domain and The Shops At La Cantera Art Festival.<br />

            <p>The location for our greater Charlotte art festivals (<strong>Lake Norman Fine Art Festival</strong> and <strong>Greater Charlotte Fine Art Festival</strong>) is Birkdale Village in Huntersville, NC. Huntersville is in the community of Lake Norman, one of the richest and most exclusive markets in the Greater Charlotte area. Birkdale Village is a life-style venue with numerous restaurants, stores, cafes, apartments, townhouses, and private residences. The show sets up on the beautiful tree-lined Concourse through the middle of Birkdale Village. These are ingredients to create a powerful venue for the 2013 events.<br />
<br />
Our fall 2012 Lake Norman event was well received by the public. Artists with expensive two-dimensional work, jewelry, and glass fared best in this inaugural year. The community was responsive with strong attendance on Saturday. On Sunday the crowd was slower to develop and remained lighter than on Saturday, although Sunday delivered big buyers. Patrons were delighted by the event, in particular surprised at the high quality of artwork. The show will remain a small boutique-style show of 78-80 artists.<br />

The Village draws not only from the Town of Fairview and City of Allen but also from the cities of Plano, McKinney, Frisco, Richardson and Dallas.&nbsp; The site, located at the intersection of Stacy Road and US 75 is only 26 miles north of downtown Dallas. The Village at Fairview is a beautiful 200-acre mixed-use lifestyle development featuring over a million square feet of retails stores and 675 multi-family residential units. The property offers main street style shopping anchored by Dillard&#39;s and Macy&#39;s along with Whole Foods Market. The Fairview Town Hall also is located at The Village.<br />

We received wonderful media support from both the Dallas Morning News and Star Publications helping to launch the inaugural show this past fall. Saturday was a steady flow of patrons while Sunday was slower but brought back customers (i.e., be-backs) and higher-ticket sales and more serious art buyers.&nbsp; Below is the average sales based on reports from 52 artists at the event.&nbsp; A few of the artists found a strong customer base and as a result, reported extremely high sales numbers.&nbsp; We knew those numbers ($4067) would skew (i.e., misrepresent) overall how artists fared.&nbsp; Thus, to calculate the average, sales were capped at $10,000.<br />

            <p>On March 29th and 30th, 2014 the City of Gulf Breeze and Gulf Breeze Arts, Inc. will present the 20th Annual Fine Arts Festival &ldquo;Gulf Breeze Celebrates the Arts&rdquo;. The Festival is a<strong> juried</strong> <strong>fine arts and fine crafts</strong> festival that brings quality national, regional, and local artists to Gulf Breeze, Florida. It is a two-day family event, free to the public with over 140 artists.<br />
<br />
Gulf Breeze is beautiful in the spring and lies conveniently between the City of Pensacola and Pensacola Beach, with easy access to the Gulf of Mexico&#39;s best beaches and a multitude of water activities. &nbsp;&nbsp;<br />
<br />
Gulf Breeze has become well known for its annual Celebrates the Arts Festival. This festival is one of the premier cultural events for our community and we&rsquo;re particularly excited this year to present our 20<sup>th</sup> Annual Event!&nbsp;<br />
<br />
Proceeds from the Gulf Breeze Celebrates the Arts Festival are used to provide art scholarships for college students&nbsp;and also distributed to local elementary, middle and high school art programs to supplement their&nbsp;often minimal&nbsp;yearly budget for art materials and supplies.&nbsp;&nbsp; Since the festival&rsquo;s inception, our scholarship endowment fund has grown to over $70,000.&nbsp; Following the 2013 Festival, we were able to donate &nbsp;~ $8,000 to the local school art programs.&nbsp; &nbsp;Our organization&rsquo;s mission is to support and encourage the next generation of artists via this annual cultural event.&nbsp;&nbsp; Gulf Breeze Arts, Inc. is a not for profit organization<br />
</p>

            <p>Fifth Annual - 2013 Hopkins Arts Festival, presented by the Friends of the Hopkins Center for the Arts.<br />
<br />
Saturday, July 13, 2013 10 am - 5 pm<br />
Sunday, July 14, 2012 10 am &ndash; 5 pm<br />
<br />
On historic Mainstreet in Hopkins, Minnesota &ndash; 15 minutes from downtown Minneapolis.<br />
<br />
OVERVIEW:<br />
The 2013 Hopkins Arts Festival will be held on historic Mainstreet in downtown Hopkins, Minnesota. The festival features a juried art fair, musical performances and summer time fare attracting over 10,000 attendees from across the Minneapolis/St. Paul metro area. The event is open and free to the public on both Saturday and Sunday from 10:00 a.m. until 5 p.m.<br />
<br />
Proceeds from the festival benefit arts programming at the Hopkins Center for the Arts. Presented by The Friends of the Hopkins Center for the Arts, a 501(c) 3 nonprofit corporation, which raises funds to provide access to high quality and affordable exhibitions, concerts, and other events for people of all ages at the Hopkins Center for the Arts.</p>

               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2375'>International Art Festival at Peace Arch Park</a> - <em><b>blaine, Washington</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2375]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            blaine, Washington - North West Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>1/30/13 Midnight PST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>6/22/13 - 6/23/13 <span style='color:red'>Show Past</span></b><br>

            <p>The International Art Festival at Peace Arch Park<br />
June 22 &amp; 23, 2013<br />
In connection with: Allied Arts of Bellingham, WA<br />
The City of Blaine, WA, Tourism Division<br />
The City of Blaine, WA, Chamber of Commerce<br />
<br />
CALL FOR SUBMISSIONS: Artists are invited to exhibit and sell their fine works of art in Peace Arch Park, located in beautiful Blaine, WA. The park rests on the Canadian and U.S. border and receives heavy traffic from both countries. Artists of the world are invited to participate in this ground-breaking multi-cultural art festival. Exhibit your work at this premier showcase for international art.<br />
Event description: The &ldquo;International Arts Festival at Peace Arch Park&rdquo; is a juried festival that will be held on the U.S. side of Peace Arch Park, in Blaine. The park showcases the area&#39;s natural beauty and highlights the unique relationship between the two countries. The festival will be filled with the diversity and rich culture provided by artists from both sides of the border. The &ldquo;International Art Festival at Peace Arch Park&rdquo; will bring together the regions finest for two days of fabulous works of visual arts, textiles, sculpture, music, dance, gourmet food and more. It is certain to be a well-attended event so please submit early.<br />
<br />
<br />
General information:<br />
Saturday, June 22, 10:00 am &ndash; 7:00 pm. Sunday, June 23, 11:00 am &ndash; 5:00 pm.<br />
booth space is 10&rsquo;x10&rsquo;<br />
This is an outdoor festival and each artist must supply their own booth; all booths must be weighted down. Festival will take place on the grass. All art work must be available for purchase and each artist must be present at their booth.<br />
Please Submit:<br />
--3-5 images of your work,. Include your name and title of the work, dimensions etc.<br />
--1 or 2 images of your booth display.<br />
--Artist r&eacute;sum&eacute; and bio or artist statement.<br />
*Deadline for submission: January 15, 2013 this festival will fill up fast. With exception a waiting list for late entries and cancellations<br />
For more info and application PLEASE visit www.zapplication.org<br />
Or Diane Major diane@majorarts.com or call 360.332.9862 for more details.</p>

            <p><div style="text-align: center;">
	<span style="color:#ff0000;"><b>&nbsp;Jewelry category is CLOSED.</b></span></div>
The <strong>Jersey Shore Fine Art Festival </strong>returns for its <strong>fifth year </strong>to the Ethel Jacobson field on <strong>Long Beach Island (LBI). &nbsp;</strong><strong>This event has the largest advertising schedule of any Paragon event. The event is sponsored by Gannett Newspapers and their affiliates.&nbsp;</strong><br />
<br />
As you all know, the Northeastern United States was brutalized by Tropical Storm Sandy in October. Specifically, Long Beach Island was severely hit and suffered damage. However, as of this writing the estimate from our hosts is more than 85% of the island is up and running. Those of you that have done shows post-hurricane realize that insurance settlements for lost and damaged possessions often leads to extensive redecorating that involves the purchase of new artwork.<br />
<br />
Given these extraordinary circumstances, Paragon is making a similarly extraordinary offer. &nbsp;The application deadline is being extended and most importantly<br />
&nbsp;<br />
<div style="text-align: center; ">
	<strong><span style="color:#ff0000;">IF YOU ARE JURIED INTO THE EVENT - YOUR BOOTH FEE WILL BE FREE</span></strong></div>
<br />
Single or doubles, both will be free. &nbsp;The only cost will be $50 for those requesting corner booths. &nbsp;Both corner and double booths will be assigned on a first-come basis determined by the date payment is received for the corner or the request is received for a double booth.<br />
<br />
We have contacted our media sponsors and they are fully behind this concept and will be increasing their support of the event. &nbsp;Further, the Director of the Chamber of Commerce in Long Beach Island is reaching out to all their local media contacts and news media contacts out of New York City. This is becoming a regional effort to bring attention and support for the event to help the artists and the community of Long Beach Island.<br />
<br />
Come join us.<br />
<br />
<span style="color:#0000ff;"><strong>2012 AVERAGE SALES: &nbsp;&nbsp;$2585 (47 artists reporting)</strong></span></p>

            <p>Now in our 43rd year, the Midsummer Festival of the Arts remains committed to providing a service to artists and to our audiences. Held at the John Michael Kohler Arts Center in Sheboygan, WI, the festival nurtures connections between artists and the public. To ensure the continued participation of as many interested artists as possible, exhibiting artists&rsquo; fees are kept moderate. Artists also enjoy many amenities, such as opportunities to explore inspiring exhibitions, a special awards banquet, $3,000 in cash prizes, food delivered directly to the booths, and much more. The Festival&rsquo;s location helps to attract patronage from throughout Wisconsin, Minnesota, and northern Illinois; attendance often exceeds 20,000. The event has long been known for its quality as well as its caring, effective staff and volunteers. Just four blocks from Lake Michigan&rsquo;s shore, this dynamic event is set amidst the gardens surrounding the Arts Center. A welcoming, light-filled, 100,000-square-foot complex, the Arts Center combines a world-class contemporary museum with a lively performing arts agenda and renowned residency and commissioning programs.</p>

               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2338'>Krasl Art Fair on the Bluff 2013</a> - <em><b>St. Joseph, Michigan</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2338]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            St. Joseph, Michigan - Central Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>1/11/13 Midnight EST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>7/13/13 - 7/14/13 <span style='color:red'>Show Past</span></b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>Apply to the Krasl Art Fair on the Bluff where estimated crowds of 70,000 plus converge annually on this beautiful resort town on the shores of Lake Michigan. The art fair is in downtown Lake Bluff Park overlooking Lake Michigan. Our mission is &ldquo;Bringing People and Art Together.&rdquo; Our goals include:<br />
Providing high quality art to the Midwest,<br />
Providing a nurturing environment for the artists,<br />
To be considered one of the best fine-art/fine craft fairs in the country and<br />
To provide jurying by judges who are &ldquo;experts in their fields.&rdquo;<br />
The Krasl Art Fair on the Bluff is the largest fund raiser for the Krasl Art Center&#39;s general education programs and exhibitions.<br />
Once a &ldquo;clothesline art fair&rdquo; in the early 1960s, Krasl Art Fair on the Bluff has become a nationally recognized and critically acclaimed event by artists, experts and patrons. The Krasl Art Fair on the Bluff continues to attract high-quality artists.<br />
The success of last year&rsquo;s event garnered the Krasl Art Fair on the Bluff an increased ranking from #24 to #20 on Sunshine Artist&rsquo;s list of &ldquo;200 Best&rdquo; fine art fairs. Among the reasons for this noteworthy ranking, Sunshine Artist magazine mentioned one painter who &ldquo;wished that they had brought more art to sell&rdquo;. Another artist noted, &ldquo;I&rsquo;ve been working fulltime doing art festivals for more than 20 years. I&rsquo;ve never been treated so well at any other show... artists are treated like royalty&rdquo;. Moreover, Greg Lawler&rsquo;s Art Fair Source Book gave in 2011 a rating of 8 out of 10 and a 32nd ranking with average sales of $4,704 to the Krasl Art Fair on the Bluff based on sales as reported by artists. (We do not have 2012 information to date.)<br />
The Krasl Art Center (KAC) is proud of these rankings and is excited by all of the positive feedback we continue to receive from the press, our dedicated volunteers, talented artists, and the community. &ldquo;The city of St. Joseph, along with the surrounding communities and businesses, should take pride in their contribution to the ranking of the Krasl Art Fair on the Bluff. Our continued success is due in-part to the enthusiasm, support and hospitality of the community.&rdquo; Sara Shambarger, Director of the Krasl Art Fair.</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2338' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>

            <p><strong>La Quinta Arts Festival</strong> is located on the spectacular grounds of the La Quinta Civic Center Campus, a short drive from legendary Palm Springs, California. The 13 acre Campus is a life-size picture postcard framed by majestic mountains, rolling green lawns, and a lake &ndash; a spectacular outdoor gallery. Hosting 230 of the nation&rsquo;s foremost contemporary artists, this four day show attracts an affluent demographic and many wealthy snowbirds with second homes in the California desert. Art sales consistently exceed $2 million; in 2013 - $2.8 million in art sales was achieved. The festival runs concurrent with the BNP Paribas Open, an international tennis event, attended by 375,000 of a highly appealing demographic as well as the polo finals &ndash; both located a few miles from the festival.<br />
<ul><li>Rated #1 Fine Art Festival and #2 Fine Craft Art Festival in the Nation by <em>Art Fair SourceBook 2013</em></li><li>Rated #7 in <em>American Style Magazine&rsquo;s</em> Top 10 Fine Art Fairs &amp; Festivals 2012 Reader&rsquo;s Poll</li><li>Ranked in the Top 10 Fine Art &amp; Design Shows in USA by <em>Sunshine Artist 2012</em></li></ul>&nbsp;<br />

               <td align='left' ><a href='javascript:expandFair(2806)'><img name='arrowImage[2806]' src='/images/arrow_right.gif' border='0'></a></td>
               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2806'>Lamar Street Festival (October 2013)</a> - <em><b>Dallas, Texas</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2806]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Dallas, Texas - Central Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>8/9/13 Midnight CST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>10/19/13 - 10/19/13</b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>The Lamar Street Festival celebrates the 100-year anniversary of the historic South Side on Lamar Building in Dallas, TX. The building&rsquo;s iconic neon sign has welcomed travelers from both sides of the Trinity River to the south side of downtown for over a decade. Since the old Sears, Roebuck &amp; Co building was turned into landmark urban residences and business lofts, the community has been the anchor for urban renewal in the area for the last sixteen years.<br />
&nbsp;<br />
The Lamar Street Festival&rsquo;s mission is to showcase the beauty and creativity of the Cedars South Side neighborhood, its businesses and its residents and to nurture artful and economic relationships with all surrounding communities.<br />
&nbsp;<br />
Just a few city blocks south of the colorful Omni Hotel and the Convention Center, this vibrant southern pocket of the city on --and around-- Lamar Street is home to numerous galleries, art studios, the new NYLO South Side Hotel, Gilley&rsquo;s, Cedars Social, the South Side Ballroom, the Beat Condos, Poor David&rsquo;s Pub, Full Circle Tavern, Off the Bone BBQ, the Dallas Police Headquarters, and the Jeff West Studios where TNT&rsquo;s &lsquo;Dallas&rsquo; television show is filmed.<br />
&nbsp;<br />
Amidst a growing collection of art galleries, urban residences, restaurants and hotels, the Lamar Street Festival will take place on Lamar between Powhattan and Belleview Street with multiple indoor and outdoor stages featuring an eclectic array of North Texas bands and performances catering to all tastes and styles.<br />
&nbsp;<br />
The festival includes the 11<sup>th</sup> Annual Cedars Open Studios as well as a juried art pavilion which provides a platform for both recognized artists as well as lesser-known talent. It will feature and an interactive art zone hosted by Big Thought and ArtLoveMagic featuring unique opportunities for families and guests of all ages to create take-home art pieces.&nbsp; Unannounced performances and creative happenings will infuse the afternoon and evening with surprises to delight guests.<br />
&nbsp;<br />
Walking tours, pedicabs for hire and shuttles will encourage guests to explore nearby destinations in the neighborhood. Many favorite Dallas culinary vendors, food trucks and beverage-makers will bookend the festival</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2806' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>
         </div>

            <p><p class="p1">
	<strong>Now in it&#39;s 44th year</strong>, and always the weekend <em>BEFORE</em> Thanksgiving, Las Artistas Art &amp; Fine Craft show serves the <strong>wealthy communities</strong> of the west side of El Paso and Las Cruces NM. Our buyers return year after year bringing new friends.<br />
	Our <strong>extensive advertising</strong> budget is funded in part by the Texas State Commission on the Arts and the City of El Paso Museums and Cultural Affairs Department.<br />
	Las Artistas Art &amp; Fine Craft Show is a small, <strong>artist-produced show</strong> that is highly competitive and strictly juried, catering to <strong>affluent and savvy buyers</strong>. &nbsp; Because the show is limited to 85 artists the share of <strong>sales revenue is greater per artist</strong>. &nbsp;Exhibitors report higher than national average (in booth) sales. &nbsp;The show has a loyal following amomgst exhibiting artists who enjoy the <strong>friendly, easy going atmosphere</strong>, very reasonable booth fees, lovely fall weather in the Southwest and consistently strong sales. <strong>&nbsp;Apply today!</strong></p>
</p>

         <td colspan='2'>
         <table width='100%'>
            <tr>
               <td align='left' ><a href='javascript:expandFair(2815)'><img name='arrowImage[2815]' src='/images/arrow_right.gif' border='0'></a></td>
               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2815'>Las Cruces Arts Fair 2014</a> - <em><b>Las Cruces, New Mexico</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2815]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Las Cruces, New Mexico - South West Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>11/29/13 Midnight MST</b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>3/14/14 - 3/16/14</b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p><strong>Las Cruces Arts Fair 2014 </strong>&nbsp;<br />
Presented by the Do&ntilde;a Arts Council in the Las Cruces Convention Center<br />
Show Dates: March 14-16, 2014, with preview party on the evening of March 14.<br />
Application Deadline: November 29, 2013 Midnight MST<br />
Phone: 575-523-6403<br />
<br />
Application to Las Cruces Arts Fair via ZAPP, the universal on-line system that allows artists to apply and manage their applications to participating art shows and events. Artists accounts are free at:&nbsp; http://www.zapplication.org/index.php<br />
&nbsp;<br />
<strong>Images:</strong> 5, including one (1) booth shot, without the applicant&rsquo;s name.<br />
&nbsp;<br />
<strong>Application/Jury Fee</strong>: $25.00<br />
&nbsp;<br />
<strong>Artwork categories</strong>: Painting and Drawing (Acrylics/Oils/Pastels/Pencil/Pen &amp; Ink/Watercolor); Woodwork, Metalwork, and Sculpture; Jewelry; Pottery, Porcelain, and Glass; Fabric, Weaving, and Leather; Printmaking and Photography; Mixed Media.<br />
&nbsp;<br />
Mass-produced or factory-produced work -- in any category -- is not permitted.&nbsp;<br />
<br />
<strong>General Information</strong>: &nbsp;In its 4th year, the Las Cruces Arts Fair is the newest juried fine art event in the Southwest. The 2014 Arts Fair will again be held in the Las Cruces Convention Center, a venue that maximizes space for artists and artisans to show their work to an enthusiastic public that is anticipating reconnecting with Arts Fair participants. Artists who participated in the 2011, 2012, and 2013 shows got to meet fine art aficionados from New Mexico, Texas, and the Borderland. All shows were a huge success for participating vendors and the public.<br />
&nbsp;<br />
The 2014 Las Cruces Arts Fair will open at 5 pm on Friday evening March 14, with a preview party. Artists and artisans will have the opportunity to meet the collectors and supporters as well as the general public in an intimate evening atmosphere. The show opens again at 10 am &ndash; 6 pm on Saturday, March 15, and 10 am &ndash; 5 pm on Sunday, March 16.<br />
&nbsp;<br />
The Do&ntilde;a Ana Arts Council, the organizer of the Arts Fair, is a non-profit 501(c)(3) arts organization that has supported and enhanced the arts and cultural life of Southern New Mexico for more than 40 years. The Arts Council&rsquo;s mission is to improve the quality of life in Las Cruces, Do&ntilde;a Ana County, and Southern New Mexico by ensuring that the performing, visual, and literary arts are an integral part of education, economic growth, and community development. The Do&ntilde;a Ana Arts Council organizes the Renaissance ArtsFaire (RenFaire), an annual outdoor festival and juried arts and crafts fair, and numerous other programs for the community. The Arts Council also manages and operates the historic Rio Grande Theatre, the oldest adobe theater in the Southwest. Proceeds from the Las Cruces Arts Fair will be used to support the Do&ntilde;a Ana Arts Council&rsquo;s many community programs.<br />
&nbsp;<br />
In 2013, the Arts Fair included a silent auction for the benefit of the Do&ntilde;a Ana Arts Council&rsquo;s programs and activities. Besides being a successful fundraiser, the silent auction provided a welcoming introduction to the variety of art that was found at the Arts Fair. Visitors had a chance to preview artists work in the silent auction before going into the main exhibition space. The 2014 Las Cruces Arts Fair will again include a silent auction.</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2815' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>
         </div>
         </td>

Building permit data show a 50 percent increase in luxury home building in the 12-month period ending in June 2011 for Longboat Key. What there is on Longboat Key is wealth and disposable income: in both the residents and tourists visiting during the winter in-season months.             <p>Every Labor Day weekend finds some 15,000 art lovers flocking to Long&#39;s Park to shop for fine arts and crafts. This top rated show draws sophisticated, high income buyers from Philadelphia, Baltimore, across Central Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Delaware, Virginia, West Virginia, Washington, DC, New York and beyond thanks to the quality of its exhibitors and extensive marketing throughout the region. Set in an old, tree-lined park where booths line walkways surrounded by a tranquil, freshwater lake, Long&#39;s Park treats its guests to a virtual outdoor gallery of the best work being created.<br />
<br />
Across 35 years, Long&#39;s Park has fostered very special relationships with its exhibitors. Booth fees include two catered breakfasts, an exhibitor picnic, and advance mailing services. In addition, RV accommodations have been expanded within the park. Plus, partnerships with a precious number of community hosts who offer guest housing on a first-come/first serve basis.</p>

Wildflowers and a formal garden make this an idyllic setting for art, food, music and entertainment. 140 high quality artists circle the large pond.<br />
<br />
The Loring Park Art Festival is coordinated by Artists for Artists, a partnership of experienced artists, whose goal is to provide an opportunity to exhibit and sell work in an atmosphere designed with the artist in mind. Rated one of the &lsquo;100 best fine art shows&rsquo; in Sunshine Artist Magazine since 2004!</p>

            <p><br />
<u><strong>ABOUT THE MANAYUNK ARTS FESTIVAL</strong></u><br />
The Manayunk Development Corporation (Manayunk.com) is pleased to announce the 2014 25th Annual Manayunk Arts Festival. This year we invite you to join us at the tri-state&#39;s largest outdoor, juried arts and crafts festival. We look forward to celebrating 25 years of presenting an eclectic variety of fine arts and crafts from across the country. Nearly 150,000 collectors, buyers, and designers will fill historic Main Street Manayunk over two days for this event.<br />
<br />
Each year we receive an exciting and unique pool of artisans and we look forward to seeing the artwork that is submitted. Our jury is faced with the challenge to select 300 artists from an annually increasing application pool. We thank you for your interest in our show!<br />
&nbsp;<br />
<u><strong>ABOUT MANAYUNK</strong></u><br />
Named a National Historic District in 1983 and a Classic Town by The Delaware Valley Regional Planning Commission in 2007, Manayunk is centrally located just 15 minutes from Center City Philadelphia, King of Prussia, Chestnut Hill, and The Main Line. Nestled along the banks of the Schuylkill River and the Manayunk Canal and Tow Path, the commercial district is lined with renovated Victorian storefronts and mill buildings giving you an urban experience with small town charm.<br />
<br />
</p>

SIXTEEN THOUSAND ADMIRERS.  <br />
AN ALARMINGLY SMALL CITY BLOCK.<br />
<br />
Greetings from the 21st Annual Marion Arts Festival, in Marion, Iowa (adjacent to Cedar Rapids, in Eastern Iowa).  Named by the Art Fair SourceBook as being among the Top 25 festivals in the nation for 2012, the MAF presents 50 artists, offering both fine art and fine craft to an audience of 16,000. <br />
<br />
Marion is a "vintage uptown" type of community, and a part of the Cedar Rapids metro area.  Our show is one-day, intimate and purposeful, with the mission to be an event through which you will thrive.  (Here, we're obligated to insert that we're volunteer-driven, kind of hokey and maybe more than a little mom-and-pop ... in good ways, mostly.)  There are no bands, there is no beer ... our festival is about the art.  (However, we do cop to falafel.)<br />

            </tr>

         <div id='fairSection[2831]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Melbourne, Florida - South East Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>12/31/13 Midnight EST</b><br>

            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>April 26 and 27, 2014 marks the 30th year of this juried Fine Art/Fine Craft Festival, showcasing the work of 250 talented artists. Our awards total $30,000 distributed among the two categories, 2-D and 3-D, and Best of Show.<br />

            <p>Now in its 37th continuous year, the Morristown CraftMarket is one of the top juried, longest-running and most successful fine art and craft shows in the nation. Showcased are extraordinary, one-of-a-kind and limited edition works of fine art and craft in all contemporary media. Each year 160 distinguished artists come from over 25 states throughout the country to exhibit in this nationally acclaimed show.<br />
<br />
The Morristown CraftMarket is heavily marketed and attracts a loyal and high income audience drawn largely from the &quot;Wealth Belt&quot; of New Jersey, which is one of the wealthiest areas in America. It includes 3 counties in New Jersey ranked by the U.S. Census Bureau as among the top 10 wealthiest in the United<br />
States based on median household income - Morris County, NJ (where the show is held) is ranked #8 in the nation; Hunterdon County, NJ is #4 in the nation; and Somerset County, NJ is #9 in the nation.<br />
<br />
This beautifully juried, indoor show is held on the spacious ground level floor of the National Guard Armory in Morristown, NJ.<br />
<br />
Pipe and drape are included in the booth fee. Also provided are drive-in setup/breakdown and plenty of free parking; 24-hour security; a complimentary Buffet Breakfast on Saturday in the Dining Room of the Armory; a complimentary Continental Breakfast on Friday during setup; and booth sitters. Artists work directly with our Show Director Geoffrey (&quot;Geoff&quot;) Price on arrangements for the show. We provide a special group hotel rate for our artists.<br />
<br />
We look forward to receiving your application!</p>

               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2748'>Mount Dora Arts Festival 39th Annual</a> - <em><b>Mount Dora, Florida</b></em></td>

         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2748]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Mount Dora, Florida - South East Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>9/30/13 Midnight EST</b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>2/1/14 - 2/2/14</b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p><div style="text-align: center;">
	<em>39TH ANNUAL MOUNT DORA ARTS FESTIVAL FEBRUARY 1ST &amp; 2ND, 2014<br />
	<br />
	<br />
	JUDGES FOR THE SHOW</em></div>
<ul><li><strong>John Wilton</strong> - As a mixed media artist, John Wilton has participated in over 100 group and 40 solo shows, winning a number of awards along the way. Wilton maintains a studio in DeLand and has served as a judge for more than 40 art shows throughout Florida. In 1995, he was awarded an Individual Artist&#39;s Fellowship from the state of Florida. Formerly a senior professor and chair of the Visual Arts Department at Daytona State College, Wilton has a degree in design from Florida State University and has done graduate work in printmaking, visual communication and education.</li></ul><ul><li><strong>David Cumbie - </strong>David&nbsp;has been active member of the Central Florida arts community for over 32 years. In addition to showing in galleries and museums in the United States and Europe, David has participated in creating art in public places since 1980. He was the first artist to receive a commission from the Orlando Percentage for the Arts Program when it was first established in 1984. He has created annual national sports awards for football and basketball; and recently created a linebacker award for the NFL. Cumbie&#39;s work was sent to Tokyo, Japan where his sculptures were used to represent America in the World Cup Floral Competition in 1990. &nbsp;In Germany, he participated in the international sculpture exhibition called the Sculpture Mile. He has participated in four cultural exchange programs: traveling art exhibitions in Italy from 1999-2002</li></ul><ul><li><strong>Adam Justice - </strong>Adam Justice is a Virginia native who moved to Lakeland, FL in 2010 to become the Curator of Art at Polk Museum of Art.&nbsp; He received his B.A. in Art History/Museum Studies from Radford University (Radford, VA).&nbsp; He received an M.A. in Art History at Virginia Commonwealth University in Richmond after defense of his thesis titled <em>Pop Art: A Case for Hyperreality and Revised Semiotics</em>.&nbsp; Previously he was the Chief Curator at William King Museum in Abingdon, VA and also served as the Director of the Southwest Blue Ridge Regions for the Virginia Association of Museums.&nbsp; He also worked at VCU&rsquo;s Anderson Gallery, The Edgar Allan Poe Museum (Richmond, VA) and taught art history at Virginia Commonwealth University, Rappahannock Community College (Warsaw, VA) and Virginia Highlands Community College (Abingdon, VA).&nbsp;</li></ul>
<div style="text-align: center;">
	IMPORTANT DATES TO REMEMBER</div>
<ul><li>APPLICATION DEADLINE&nbsp; -&nbsp; SEPTEMBER 30TH, 2013</li><li>JURY PROCESS&nbsp; -&nbsp; OCTOBER 7TH - 18TH, 2013</li><li>INVITATION TO SHOW&nbsp; -&nbsp; OCTOBER 18TH, 2013</li><li>DEADLINE TO ACCEPT AND PAY&nbsp; -&nbsp; DECEMBER 1ST, 2013</li><li>DEADLINE TO CANCEL&nbsp; -&nbsp; DECEMBER 15TH, 2013</li></ul>
<div style="text-align: center;">
	<u><strong>SHOW RULES</strong></u><strong><u> AT A GLANCE</u></strong></div>
<ul><li>MUST HAVE WHITE TENT, NO TENT AWNING OR EXTENSIONS ALLOWED PER CITY ORDINANCE</li><li>ACCEPTABLE ART IS LIMITED TO ORIGINAL ONE-OF-A-KIND ARE CREATED AND PRESENTED BY THE CREATING ARTIST</li><li>ALL REPRODUCTIONS ARE PLACED IN BROWSE BINS AT THE <strong><u>BACK OF THE TENT ONLY</u></strong> AND MAY ONLY REPRESENT 30% OF WORK DISPLAYED</li><li>ALL REPRODUCTIONS MUST BE CLEARLY AND INDIVIDUALLY LABELED &quot;REPRODUCTIONS&quot; NO OTHER TERM IS ALLOWED</li><li>REPRODUCTIONS CAN NOT BE HUNG ALONG SIDE ORIGINAL WORK</li><li>EMBELLISHED REPRODUCTIONS ARE NOT CONSIDERED ORIGINAL WORK</li><li>REPRODUCTIONS MUST BE SIGNED EDITIONS OF NO MORE THAN 750</li><li>ART ASSEMBLED FROM KITS, PRE-CRAVED OR PRE-MOLDED, MANUFACTURED PARTS, BUY-SELL, COMMERCIAL, AND THE LIKE ARE NOT ACCEPTABLE. FINAL INTERPRETATION OF THE ARTWORK WILL BE MADE BY MDCA</li><li>ARTISTS SELECTED BY MDCA ONLY MAY EXHIBIT AT THE MOUNT DORA ARTS FESTIVAL. ALL ARTISTS LISTED ON THE APPLICATION MUST BE PRESENT FOR THE DURATION OF THE SHOW. ASSISTANTS ARE WELCOME BUT NOT IN PLACE OF THE ARTIST.</li><li>NO PETS ALLOWED PER CITY ORDINANCE</li></ul></p>

            <tr>
               <td align='left' ><a href='javascript:expandFair(2317)'><img name='arrowImage[2317]' src='/images/arrow_right.gif' border='0'></a></td>
               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2317'>Mount Gretna Outdoor Art Show 2013</a> - <em><b>Mount Gretna, Pennsylvania</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2317]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Mount Gretna, Pennsylvania - North East Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>4/1/13 Midnight EST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>8/17/13 - 8/18/13 <span style='color:red'>Show Past</span></b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>The thirty eighth annual show will be held &quot;Under the Trees of Old Chautauqua&quot; on August 17 and 18, 2013.<br />
<br />
The Pennsylvania Chautauqua sponsors an Art Show, as a community fundraiser, on the third full weekend in August. The Pennsylvania Chautauqua is a non-profit organization established in 1892 for the purpose of &quot;the advancement of literary, scientific, intellectual, physical and social welfare and the promotion of cultural and religious activities, recreation and entertainment&rdquo;.<br />
<br />
Mount Gretna is a small Victorian community founded in the late 1800&#39;s as a summer resort. Initially the only way for residents to reach their cottages in the woods was to travel by train. Gretna was a stop along the Cornwall/Lebanon line. Our streets were footpaths until automobiles became the mode of travel. Many of the original cottages surround an open-air playhouse where numerous cultural events are held. Our quaint atmosphere attracts many visitors every summer for music, theater, a visit to the local ice cream shop or just a walk in the woods and, of course, to the Art Show!</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2317' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>
         </div>
         </td>
      </tr>

            <p>Established in 1985, the Riverwalk Fine Art Fair is among the top rated art fairs in the nation. Held annually on the prestigious Riverwalk in Naperville, Illinois, the two day event draws more than 74,000 art conscious citizens from near and far. Enjoyed by artists for its sophisticated crowds, attentive staff and beautiful location, the fair is recognized as a premier festival of fine art and fine craft. The show has earned the reputation of being well juried, skillfully organized and very artist friendly. A strong advertising campaign helps to keep this highly anticipated event a favorite of both vendors and patrons.</p>

            <p>The Neptune Festival Art &amp; Craft Show (September 27-29) is part of a citywide festival at the Virginia Beach oceanfront. Commercial vendors run 1st-17th Streets on the boardwalk and the Art/Craft Show runs 18th-29th Streets on the boardwalk. The Art &amp; Craft Show portion is produced by The Virginia Museum of Contemporary Art. The art/craft show jury fee is $35 and the artist booth fee is $385 per 10x10 for the entire weekend. Artists and craftsmen in all media are eligible for the art/craft portion of the festival, and acceptance is based on a blind jury process. The art/craft section of the festival (18th-29th Streets) does not allow commercial or imported products. In all cases, the spirit of our guidelines intends that the work depend heavily on the &ldquo;handmade&quot; aspect of art and craft. If you are not an artist or crafter you may apply for the commercial section of the festival by contacting the Neptune Festival headquarters directly at 757-498-0215.</p>

            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2705]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Philadelphia, Pennsylvania - North East Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>8/1/13 Midnight EST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            <p><p class="p1">
	The Nutcracker Market takes place at The Kimmel Center for Performing Arts in Philadelphia. Approximately 50 exhibitors will be set-up on the Commonwealth Plaza and Tier One of the Center. Two-thirds of the exhibitor selection will be hand-made American crafts and the balance gift items (like: PA Ballet Store), a community performance stage with three shows per day, family-centered activities, roaming Nutcracker characters and dancers from the Ballet will be ongoing . Decor is holiday inspired. Food &amp; beverage provided by notable Jose Garces Group (<a href="http://www.garcesgroup.com"><span class="s2">www.garcesgroup.com</span></a>).&nbsp;<br />
	<br />
	We are now offering a 15% discount to all exhibitors --see changes below.</p>
<p class="p2">
	The Market opens Friday, Dec. 6, 2013 at 6pm for a ticketed preview party followed by two full shopping days: Saturday and Sunday December 7 and 8.&nbsp; The Philadelphia Orchestra has (3) scheduled performances in the building and the PA Ballet opens sold out performances of Balanchine&#39;s Nutcracker at the Academy of Music just a block away (3 performances align with market times) all adding to the audiences of family, friends, area residents, tourists, etc.</p>
<p class="p2">
	This Market is to become an annual Philadelphia holiday tradition, and serve to be the Ballet&rsquo;s signature fundraiser event helping to support the programing of the Company and the <i>School for the Pennsylvania Ballet. </i>The Market is based on the successes of Houston and Montreal&#39;s Nutcracker Markets.<br />
	<br />
	Exhibitors are asked to donate one item for the Friday night preview party raffle.<br />
	<br />
	Dance inspired crafts are encouraged.<br />
	<br />
	Please contact us with any quesiotns? concerns? you have!<br />
	(646) 409-7777 (cell)</p>
<p class="p2">
	&nbsp;</p>
</p>

            <p>Now in it&rsquo;s second year, the Peachtree Hills Festival of the Arts is a two-day outdoor local arts and crafts event held on June 8-9, 2013. The festival is located in the very heart of Atlanta connecting Buckhead with Ansley Park along a tree-lined thoroughfare near Peachtree Hills Park, easily accessible from Peachtree Rd. and the Lindberg Marta station. Visitors are encouraged to park and stroll the festival route. This diverse and densely populated area boasts a design center and some of Atlanta&rsquo;s best addresses. Approximately 200 artists will participate in this annual event, with plenty of room to grow.</p>

               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2403'>Peoria Art Guild 51st Annual Fine Art Fair 2013</a> - <em><b>Peoria, Illinois</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2403]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Peoria, Illinois - Central Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>3/17/13 Midnight CST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>9/28/13 - 9/29/13</b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>The 51st Annual Peoria Art Guild Fine Art Fair<br />
September 28 - 29, 2013<br />
<br />
You&rsquo;ve heard the word. Experience it for yourself. You are celebrated and appreciated by 40,000 art enthusiasts and 400 dedicated volunteers. You are promoted in national and regional outlets. You get the chance to showcase your work in a scenic riverfront venue. Your lunches are delivered. In a nutshell, that&rsquo;s the Peoria Art Guild Fine Art Fair.<br />
<br />
Ask the artists who have exhibited in Peoria. No one does it better. We excel in artist amenities from complimentary lunch and breakfast to an Artist Awards dinner that is standing room only. We work hard to make your experience in the heart of the Midwest affordable, fun and unforgettable. With 35% of our exhibiting artists new each year, we never tire of hearing: &ldquo;Wow, I never thought I&rsquo;d sell this well and have this much fun in Peoria Illinois!&rdquo;</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2403' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>

            <p>The 43rd Annual Peters Valley Fine Craft Fair is held at the Sussex County Fairgrounds in Augusta, NJ and attracts approximately 7,000 shoppers throughout the weekend. This professional, well promoted 2 day event includes artist demos, awards, live music, kids art area and food vendors. Setup begins on Friday at 8am and exhibitors must complete their booth set up by 6pm on Friday or by 9:30am on Saturday. The Fair opens on Saturday at 10am with booth judging from 10am - 12 noon. Awards will be given at the artists&rsquo; booth. The fair closes at 6pm Saturday and continues on Sunday from 10am-5pm.</p>

            <p>In its 34th year, the Piccolo Spoleto Craft Shows are part of a seventeen-day comprehensive arts festival that attracts over 250,000 visitors. Held in the heart of historic Charleston, SC, the two events attract more than 7,000 eager patrons, gallery owners, and design professionals each weekend. Artists throughout the nation who create contemporary and traditional fine craft are encouraged to apply. These award-winning events are extremely artist-friendly and provide opportunities for on-site sales, wholesale account development, and a chance to partake of many performing and visual arts experiences.</p>

               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2283'>Piedmont Craftsmen</a> - <em><b>Winston-Salem, North Carolina</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2283]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Winston-Salem, North Carolina - South East Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>4/17/13 Midnight EST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>11/15/13 - 11/17/13</b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>Thank you for your interest in Piedmont Craftsmen and welcome to the annual jury process. When you apply to Piedmont Craftsmen, you are applying to more than a beautiful annual show. You are applying for lifetime exhibiting membership in one of the country&#39;s finest craft guilds. Since its founding in 1964, Piedmont Craftsmen has evolved into one of the nation&rsquo;s most highly respected craft guilds, with close to 400 members. We present an annual Fair that is considered one of the finest in the southeastern United States. Total sales by 125 exhibiting craftsmen are estimated at nearly $400,000. Piedmont Craftsmen&rsquo;s Gallery and Shop anchor the Arts District in downtown Winston-Salem, NC. The gallery attracts over 18,000 visitors each year, and grossed more than $250,000 in sales of fine craft. Visit www.piedmontcraftsmen.org for more information about Piedmont Craftsmen.<br />
Piedmont Craftsmen holds a two-part jury process each year for craftsmen interested in becoming Exhibiting Members. This is Part 1, the Image Jury. Applicants must live and work in one of the 50 states in the United States of America. Deadline: The application, images and other required materials must be submitted electronically by midnight, Wednesday, April 17, 2013.</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2283' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>
         </div>

            <p>The Piedmont Park Summer Arts &amp; Crafts Festival is an annual arts, crafts and entertainment event held at Piedmont Park. This midtown community is home to some of the best arts and entertainment events in the country as well as enthusiastic art buyers. In 2011 the festival included the largest &ldquo;flash mob&rdquo; in Georgia! The 2013 event will include up to 250 exhibitors in Atlanta&rsquo;s favorite park in the shade of its many trees, green space and Lake Clara Meer. Hosts AFFPS are &ldquo;bringing back&rdquo; this atypical show reminiscent of the days when local art events were held in the park. &ldquo;This one&rsquo;s for our local artists and crafters, people in the community, neighbors and friends.&rdquo; The event is hosted by AFFPS by artists for artists.</p>

With a stunning view of Pikes Peak mountain, the park is named for the iconic American anthem inspired by the mountain itself. A juried arts festival, Pikes Peak Arts Fest exhibits 100+ national, regional and local artists. Free to the public, the event features a primary focus on visual artist booths, and also includes three days of music performances and arts happenings.</p>

            <p>For two days every fall, the Plantation Junior Woman&rsquo;s Club Foundation presents its annual arts festival in Liberty Tree Park in Plantation, Florida. This year&#39;s ART IN THE PARK, our 47th, will be held November 9<sup>th</sup> &amp; 10<sup>th</sup>, 2013. Our theme this year is &ldquo;<em>Home is Where the Art Is</em>&rdquo;.<br />
<br />
Funds raised by ART IN THE PARK are returned to our community through local organizations such as the Plantation High School Art Club, Helen B. Hoffman Library, Young at Art Children&rsquo;s Museum (benefiting low-income Plantation children), and 4Kids of South Florida.<br />

         <div id='fairSection[2642]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Missouri - Central Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>5/2/13 Midnight CST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>9/22/13 - 9/24/13</b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>One of the longest-running and most beloved art festivals in the country, the Plaza Art Fair is in its 82nd year. Enjoyed by artists for its knowledgeable crowds, attentive staff and beautiful location on the historic Country Club Plaza in Kansas City, Missouri, the Plaza Art Fair attracts 300,000 art patrons each year. Ranked in the top ten fine arts festivals in the Art Fair SourceBook, it has grown over seven decades to be a premier festival of fine art and fine craft. The Plaza Art Fair is consistently recognized as Kansas City&rsquo;s best annual event. It marks the arrival of autumn for Kansas Citians and artists alike, and attracts tourists from all over the Midwest.</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2642' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>
         </div>

            Pound Ridge, NY, New York - North East Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>8/10/13 Midnight EST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            <p><br />
In 2013, the Pound Ridge Fine Arts Festival will celebrate its 23rd year at Scotts Corners, in Pound Ridge, New York, approximately 45 minutes north of New York City in Westchester County. This&nbsp;community event&nbsp;is part of the fall foliage tour of New England, and in 2012 the&nbsp;show was taken over by the directorship of David Oleski Events. The show will be limited to only 50 exhibitors this year to insure that artists are properly showcased and presented. Pound Ridge is sometimes referred to as &quot;Second Hollywood&quot;, due to the large number of music, fashion,&nbsp;film and stage artists that have taken&nbsp;up residence here, creating an exceptionally exclusive and affluent audience.</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2492' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>

         <div id='fairSection[2342]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Minneapolis, Minnesota - Central Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>3/20/13 Midnight CST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>8/3/13 - 8/4/13 <span style='color:red'>Show Past</span></b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>The Powderhorn Art Fair is a Fine Arts and Fine Crafts Upper Midwest Regional Art Fair. Set in Powderhorn Park, a pastoral 66 acre city park, 184 artists circle around the tree-lined, picturesque Powderhorn Lake. Powderhorn Art Fair is a unique collaboration between the Powderhorn Park Neighborhood Association and the Minneapolis Park and Recreation Board. The art fair profits are used to pay for programs at Powderhorn Park.<br />
<br />
Dates: August 3 &amp; 4, 2013<br />
Times: Saturday 10 AM - 6 PM and<br />
Sunday 10 AM - 5 PM<br />
www.powderhornartfair.org<br />
<br />
Application Deadline: March 20<br />
Notification by March 30<br />
Confirmation deadline May 1<br />
There will be no refunds of booth fees after accepting our invitation to exhibit.</p>

         <div id='fairSection[2711]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Las Cruces, New Mexico -  Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>8/17/13 Midnight MST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>11/2/13 - 11/3/13</b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>The Do&ntilde;a Ana Arts Council&rsquo;s Renaissance ArtsFaire is an annual event held at Young Park in Las Cruces, New Mexico.&nbsp; The lake, towering trees and rolling lawns provide an idyllic setting for the Faire.&nbsp; Unique costumed entertainers, medieval decorations and special food booths add to the Renaissance atmosphere.<br />
&nbsp;<br />
The Do&ntilde;a Ana Arts Council, Inc., is a non-profit organization working to improve the quality of life in Las Cruces and Southern New Mexico by ensuring that the performing, visual and literary arts are an integral part of education, economic growth and community development.&nbsp; The Renaissance ArtsFaire is the Arts Council&rsquo;s major fundraising event.&nbsp; All income generated by gate receipts, booth fees and Pepsi sales goes to support arts in education and other Arts Council programs throughout the year.<br />
&nbsp;<br />
The ArtsFaire focuses on a juried arts show wherein the jurors select participants exhibiting only the highest quality arts and crafts.&nbsp; Artists&rsquo; booths are supported by performances of music, dance, theater and a variety of food booths, all presented in a Renaissance theme.<br />
&nbsp;<br />
The Arts Council&rsquo;s Renaissance ArtsFaire, featuring approximately 180 artists&rsquo; booths, is recognized as one of the finest of its kind in the Southwest.&nbsp; The event is widely promoted throughout the region in print, radio, television and direct mailings.&nbsp; Attendance is 25,000 to 30,000 visitors each year.<br />
&nbsp;<br />
Your completed Renaissance ArtsFaire artist application must be Received no later than&nbsp;<strong>July 19, 2013.</strong>&nbsp; We hope you will join us for this special celebration of the arts.<br />
<br />
<br />
&nbsp;<br />
</p>

            <p>The Fairfax Festival of the Arts will move to the Lake Anne Plaza in downtown Reston, VA becoming the <b>Reston Fine Art Festival</b> to be held on the same dates - October 12-13, 2013. Lake Anne Plaza is historically the initial phase of the planned community that has come to be known as Reston, VA. Modeled after a coastal village in Italy, the brick plaza, shops and residences surrounding Lake Anne have the form and feel of a European waterfront community. Its unique design and sense of place are recognized worldwide by planners, architects and developers.<br />
<br />
Lake Anne Plaza sits in an Historic Overlay District comprised of a unique group of independently owned retail and dining establishments. Lake Anne Plaza is considered the heart and soul of historic Reston. Residents of the Lake Anne Plaza area and Reston proper are committed to supporting independently owned businesses to the extent that only independently owned businesses operate at Lake Anne &mdash; there are no corporate chains here. This creates a unique flavor to the venue arising from this strong sense of community among the residents.</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2474' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>

Held in the mild and refreshing days of early spring, the Ridgeland Fine Arts Festival presents artists and their work against the splendid setting of Renaissance at Colony Park, a regional lifestyle center renowned for its shopping, dining and entertainment as well as for its graceful Old World architecture inspired by the cities of Europe and the Mediterranean.<br />
&nbsp;<br />

            <p><b>RIO GRANDE ARTS &amp; CRAFTS FESTIVALS</b><br />
14th ANNUAL HOLIDAY SHOW-THANKSGIVING WEEKEND<br />
November 29, 30, and December 1st, 2013<br />
The Lujan Exhibit Complex at Expo NM<br />
Albuquerque, New Mexico<br />
<br />
<p>
	The Rio Grande Arts and Crafts Festival introduces a vibrant lineup of juried artists and craftsmen to Albuquerque over the busiest shopping weekend of the year, Thanksgiving Weekend. Set indoors at the historic Expo New Mexico, this well-promoted festival draws huge crowds of art enthusiasts and holiday buyers. Albuquerque was recently ranked as one of the Top 10 Art Destinations in the United States, and <i>Sunshine Artist Magazine&rsquo;s</i> 200 Best issue tips a hat to this festival as the best holiday show in the Southwest. Early deadline this year was April 1,&nbsp;with a&nbsp;secondary jury round, deadline July 1.</p>
<p>
	To accommodate Thanksgiving plans, we offer early set-up on Wednesday.</p>

            <p><p>
	For 25 years, the Rio Grande Arts and Crafts Festival has been rounding up world-class artists and craftsmen and bringing them together under a legendary white tent in the Land of Enchantment. Taking place the first and second weekends of October, this annual Albuquerque favorite has earned its place as a cornerstone of must-see attractions during the Albuquerque International Balloon Fiesta. Over 80,000 shoppers and out-of-town visitors flock to the huge peaked tent framed by colorful hot air balloons, bustling with 280 of the most talented artisans from all over the map. This extraordinary fall festival is ranked by <i>Sunshine Artist Magazine </i> as 15th in the nation, and artists rave about high attendance and exceptional sales.</p>
<p>
	&nbsp;</p>
</p>

            Rising Sun, Indiana - Central Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>

            <p>The Rising Sun Festival of Fine Arts &amp; Crafts takes place in Rising Sun Indiana&#39;s historic Riverfront district along the city&#39;s landscaped river-walk on the Ohio River. Over 100 artists will be juried into the fair by a panel of prominent art experts. The Festival is organized and operated by many Rising Sun volunteers who are dedicated to making this a rewarding and pleasurable experience for both the artists and attendees. Many artists&#39; amenities, as well as a large promotional budget, are in place to ensure the success of our artists. We are purposely keeping our jury and booth fees affordable to encourage artist participation in 5th Annual Festival.</p>

            <p>The Salida Riverside Fine Arts Festival invites artists to exhibit in this regional juried fine arts event, August 10 and 11. The producers of this festival are dedicated to the arts and to providing an excellent venue for accomplished artists to show and sell works of art. Each year the comments of the exhibitors are reviewed and the producers incorporate those suggestions that will help to create a prosperous show. This is the fifth consecutive year and is a select show of excellent and diverse artists, with many returning each year. Our vision is to provide the local and visiting public and our exhibitors a memorable and high quality festival experience.<br />
<br />
Salida is located in the heart of the South Central Rockies and has the distinction of being one of &quot;America&#39;s best art towns&quot;, according to The 100 Best Art Towns in America, by author John Villani. White water rafting, &#39;Fourteener&#39; mountain hiking, horseback riding, many excellent area hot springs, world class river fishing and the charm of a small mountain town with 15 art galleries, unique boutiques and venues featuring local musicians make Salida a popular vacation spot. This is the beautiful area of the Rocky Mountains that inspired the artist Christo to propose his latest artwork, &quot;Over the River&quot;!<br />
<br />
The festival site is located on the banks of the Arkansas River in a picturesque willow tree filled park with lush green lawns in the downtown Historic District. Colorful kayakers, rafters and fly fishermen can be seen from the festival site and enhance the mood of the festival. Riverside Park Ampitheater features the best of local talent entertaining festival attendees and exhibitors. For more details visit the festival website www.coloradofestivalsandevents.com.<br />
NOTE: EARLY DISCOUNTED APPLICATIONS DEADLINE FEB 8. LATE APPLICATION DEADLINE APRIL 12 (A NEW ZAPP POSTING WILL BE AVAILABLE).</p>

Now in its 28th year, the event has grown from a small, picnic-style gathering to over 20,000 attendees and the largest annual event in Sandy Springs. This celebration of community and tradition is located in the center of the Sandy Springs business district on and around Heritage Green. The Artists Market includes approximately 120 artists and hand crafters and is managed by the Atlanta Foundation for Public Spaces. This is an ideal venue for local artists and crafters in the moderate price range.</p>

            <p>In a community renowned for its devotion to the arts, Scottsdale Arizona has one arts festival that rises above them all. After four decades, the Scottsdale Arts Festival, held every March during the height of Scottsdale&#39;s tourist season, has established a solid reputation as the premiere arts festival in the Southwest. The Festival draws up to 40,000 visitors during the 3-day weekend and features the work of 190 artists. Voted as one of the top five favorite Arts Festivals by the readers of American Style Magazine, the festival is set among the lush gardens and beautiful public art sculptures on the Scottsdale Civic Center Mall, the festival delights art buyers with juried, gallery-quality fine arts and fine crafts, gourmet food trucks, children&#39;s art activities and entertainment.</p>

            <p>Welcome to the Seabrook Festival of the Arts to be held on October 25<sup>th</sup>, 26<sup>th</sup> and 27th, 2013.<br />
The Seabrook Festival of the Arts in Seabrook, Texas is presented by the Art Consortium of the Texas Gulf Coast.<br />
<br />
The Art Consortium of the Texas Gulf Coast brings together artists, organizations and art enthusiasts to advocate, promote and provide opportunities to create and celebrate the arts in Seabrook and &nbsp;all Texas Gulf Coast residents and visitors.<br />
&nbsp;<br />
Through leadership and innovation, we are committed to preserving our cultural and creative diversity by building community where the arts are a vital part of everyday life.<br />
&nbsp;<br />
The Art Consortium of the Texas Gulf Coast believes that the arts should be universal, affordable and accessible to everyone regardless of age, capacity, limitations or language. The arts build community, add to the beauty of our environment, record our history, are an economic boon and create opportunities for breaking down barriers, reducing levels of intimidation and building bridges.<br />
<br />
<em>Our priorities are:</em><br />
<ul><li>Present the Seabrook Festival of the Arts and other community art events</li><li>Support performing and visual art programs in the schools</li><li>Offer artistic opportuinties to the community through classes and workshops</li><li>Develop partnerships with others to create a strong arts presence in the area</li></ul>&nbsp;<br />
<strong>Join us in celebrating our 2nd year of bringing fine arts to Seabrook, Texas!</strong><br />
</p>

            <p>Now in its 23rd year, the Sedona Arts Festival is a favorite in the Southwest. It has become a premiere destination arts festival, known for the quality of art and first class treatment of both its artists and its guests. With Sedona&rsquo;s spectacular red rocks as a backdrop and glorious fall weather to compliment the event, the festival attracts more than 4000 seasonal and year round residents and tourists. The festival showcases 125 fine artists from around the country, as well as a Gourmet Gallery which features locally produced and packaged food items. KidZone offers art activities for children. Raffle prizes and a variety of food and beverages are available as well. Admission fee: $10 at the gate, $8 online in advance. We cater to our visiting artists, providing load/unload assistance, refreshments, and premium restroom facilities exclusive for artists. Applications for the Sedona Arts Festival are available on Zapplication.com.</p>

            <p>Fire on the Mountain Festivals ~ well known for producing festivals &ldquo;with feeling&rdquo; ~ fun filled, intimate atmosphere, with well balanced, clear sound systems, brightly decorated halls, and the good company of other high caliber artists. All of this and an appreciative craft &amp; graphics art buying clientele! We employ an upscale presentation our &ldquo;quality-emphasizing&rdquo; advertising. We spent lots more on advertising in 2012, trying to deal with the economy&rsquo;s problems. &nbsp;We always provide a wide variety of fine entertainment on multiple stages - up tempo folk, bluegrass, jazz &amp; blues, world &amp; ethnic, Cajun, classical musicians, joined by jugglers, magicians, storytellers and strolling street performers - truly a cultural feast for everyone. And speaking of feasts, there is always the aroma of home-baked, seasonal meals and treats wafting through the festival. Fire on the Mountain Festivals always goes all out to make sure there is plenty of the finest foods and drink purveyors for you and your buyers. Our shows are built upon 38 years of being attentive to details which keep a loyal buying public, their families and friends coming to our shows year after year!<br />
<br />
We wish all of you in the craft family a happy, successful year! Rich, Corinne, Family &amp; Staff<br />

<br />
The S Fourth St Section is the 2nd largest section with 160 artists. Located in the center of the 3.5 block show area, pedestrian traffic is heavy and artists generally report good sales. Booths are mostly level on the street, and directly accessible by vehicle pre- and post-show. Event organizers work diligently to cater to different artistic preferences and budgets, so there is a mix of fine art, fine craft and contemporary/traditional craft. The result is a tasteful selection of high-quality original works. Proceeds from the show fund various community charities, art scholarships and neighborhood maintenance and restoration.<br />

      <tr>
         <td colspan='2'>
         <table width='100%'>
            <tr>
               <td align='left' ><a href='javascript:expandFair(2868)'><img name='arrowImage[2868]' src='/images/arrow_right.gif' border='0'></a></td>
               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2868'>St. Stephens Art Show 2014</a> - <em><b>Coconut Grove, Florida</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2868]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Coconut Grove, Florida - South East Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>11/1/13 Midnight EST</b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>2/15/14 - 2/17/14</b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>Celebrating 25 years of Art and Community! The St. Stephen&rsquo;s Art Show invites you to apply to our 25th Annual Outdoor Juried Fine Art Show, highly ranked in the country by Sunshine Artist Magazine. Be one of more than 160 top artists during South Florida&rsquo;s premier art weekend at the St. Stephen&rsquo;s Art Show and refer an artist for $25 credit on your booth fee. Referred Artists note your name on their application and upon acceptance artits receive teh anniversary credit.<br />
<br />
An oasis of art, you will enjoy three days of sales on the shady campus of St. Stephen&rsquo;s Episcopal Church, located in Coconut Grove, Florida and within steps of the Coconut Grove Arts Festival. The Show will be celebrating it&#39;s 25th anniversary year and has four new media partners promoting the festival and exciting surprises for artists and patrons alike. &nbsp;<br />
<br />
Long considered a nationally important show in its own right while still maintaining &ldquo;Art is in the Heart&rdquo; feel, the show has a consistent A+ rating for artist treatment and amenities as reported by the artists.&nbsp;&nbsp;Award winners are automatically juried through the next year and have guaranteed booth of choice. Third year veterans are guaranteed their booth choice as well. Second&nbsp;year returning artists have preference of booth spaces and new artists requests will be honored wherever possible. Award winners also automatically are nominated for the Disney &reg; Festival of the Masters by the St. Stephens Judges in partnership with Disney&reg; and St. Stephens Art Show.<br />
<br />
Presented by St. Stephen&rsquo;s Episcopal Church, a 100 year resident of Coconut Grove, the St. Stephen&rsquo;s Art Show is a not for profit event that helps to fund outreach programs in the Coconut Grove and Miami area. To increase the charitable giving permitted by the event, the St. Stephen&rsquo;s Art Show charges a $2 admission to adults and children over 12. St. Stephen&rsquo;s offers a range of cultural, spiritual and entertainment offerings to the community as part of its vision to be &ldquo;The Heart of the Grove, and Reaching Beyond&rdquo;.</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2868' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>
         </div>
         </td>
      </tr>

There will be an Opening Night Preview on Friday, November 15. This popular southern open air art fair attracts thousands of high-end art collectors, tourists, area residents and families and is open to artists displaying and selling works in various artistic disciplines including painting, printmaking, drawing/pastel, digital media, sculpture, jewelry, ceramics/pottery, photography, furniture, glass, textiles/fiber, and mixed media.&nbsp; Approximately 120 artists will be selected for the 19<sup>th</sup> Annual Telfair Art Fair and $12,000 in prizes will be awarded.<br />

            <p>Scheduled for December 6 - 8, 2013, the Fall Tempe Festival of the Arts is among the oldest, largest, and best-loved traditions in the Desert Southwest. Held over a 3-day weekend, more than 225,000 visitors shop from the Valley&rsquo;s best selection of fine art and craft, from as many as 400 artists who come from throughout North America. The Festival occurs in a festive street fair atmosphere in the Mill Avenue District of downtown Tempe, Arizona.<br />
<br />
This juried show promotes original art with all artists on site to engage visitors. The event is held semi-annually, taking advantage of the &ldquo;snow bird&rdquo; high season in Arizona. More than a quarter of the Festival&rsquo;s visitors are escaping the winter blues and come from outside Phoenix and outside Arizona, shopping for the perfect one-of-a-kind gift.<br />
<br />
It&rsquo;s fun for the whole family, too, with live entertainment, Kids Innovation Station where children make art they can take home free, the Arizona Wine Festival and The Art of Beer. The Fall Tempe Festival of the Arts offers a wide variety of amenities for artists including hospitality carts, booth sitting services, a large-art delivery assistance program, and a 24-hour security patrol.</p>

            <p>The 32nd Annual Highlands Juried Craft Show will be held October 18, 19, and 20, 2013 in the Field House at Germantown Academy in Fort Washington, Pennsylvania, about one mile down the road from The Highlands historic mansion and gardens. Featuring over 60 high-caliber artists from throughout the United States, this well known and established Philadelphia area craft show is settling in to larger and more comfortable accommodations in the new Field House at Germantown Academy, which offers ground-level access to the exhibit area, indoor booths for all exhibitors, and paved parking immediately adjacent to the building for all guests. Talented craft artists will display the highest quality of handmade jewelry, furniture, clothing, home d&eacute;cor, and more, available for purchase. In 2013, the second year at this venue, we will re-design the floorplan, dramatically expand our advertising reach in print, radio and social media outlets in the area, and expand connections with the Germantown Academy community.</p>

<br />
Culinairia is a San Antonio nonprofit whose mission is&nbsp;to showcase, through events, the best food and wines as well as the people who produce them from Texas and around the world. Revenues from the events support local students in culinary arts and food related aid organizations.&nbsp;<br />
&nbsp;<br />
<strong>The Shops At La Cantera</strong> is located in <strong>San Antonio </strong>in the affluent area of La Cantera. Nearby attractions include several golf resorts, The Westin La Cantera Hill Country Resort and Six Flags Fiesta Texas. The Shops At La Cantera attracts shoppers from the entire region as well as the many tourists that visit San Antonio.&nbsp;Presented By Lynette Wallace Productions LLC&nbsp;&nbsp;<br />
The Shops At La Cantera Art Festival is the 2nd fall event in the Blue Lotus Art Show Tour following Art Austin@The Domain, September 28 &ndash; 29 and&nbsp; before Georgetown Art In The Square, October 26-27 .<br />

            <p><strong><strong>About the Event</strong></strong><br />
Held in the historic art colony of Tubac, the annual Festival of the Arts is Arizona&rsquo;s longest running arts festival, drawing tens of thousands of visitors each year. The festival runs concurrent with Tucson&rsquo;s internationally renowned Gem &amp; Mineral Show which brings visitors from around the World. Many Tucson visitors make both the Gem &amp; Mineral show and the Festival of the Arts their destination.<br />
<em><strong>&nbsp;</strong></em><br />
<strong><strong>Tubac</strong><strong> Village</strong></strong><br />
The Tubac Chamber of Commerce, our volunteers, Village merchants and residents work together to create a welcoming atmosphere for our visiting artists. Local Information will be in your move-in packet.<br />
<em><strong>&nbsp;</strong></em><br />
<strong><strong>Advertising</strong></strong><br />
The Chamber advertises in newspapers throughout the state, runs TV ads, radio spots, online calendars, digital billboards, our website and through social media. An event program listing all artists will be available at the festival.<br />
</p>

               <td align='left' ><a href='javascript:expandFair(2356)'><img name='arrowImage[2356]' src='/images/arrow_right.gif' border='0'></a></td>
               <td align='left' width='98%'><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2356'>Utah Arts Festival 2013</a> - <em><b>Salt Lake City, Utah</b></em></td>
               
            </tr>
         </table>
         <div id='fairSection[2356]' style='display:none' class='collapsed'>
            Salt Lake City, Utah - South West Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>2/28/13 Midnight MST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>6/20/13 - 6/23/13 <span style='color:red'>Show Past</span></b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>The 37th annual Utah Arts Festival is scheduled for June 20 &ndash; 23 2013 from noon to 11 pm daily at the Library Square in downtown Salt Lake City. More than 150 visual artists from across the country are juried in to participate in our Artists Marketplace. The Utah Arts Festival is the largest outdoor multi-disciplined event held in Utah. Having garnered numerous awards internationally, nationally and locally, the Festival remains one of the premiere events that kick off the summer in Utah each June. More than 80,000 patrons enjoy four days of award-winning fine arts in the Artist Marketplace, live performances on five stages, street theater, a fine arts exhibition, a film program, children&rsquo;s art and culinary arts.</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2356' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>
         </div>
         </td>
      </tr>

            <p>Vail, Colorado is home to one of the most spectacular mountain resorts in the world.  Located just 90 minutes west of the Denver metro area, this well-known, year-round vacation destination is also a haven for an affluent, well-educated, art savvy local population.  The Vail Arts Festival is Vail's longest-running art festival, located in the Town of Vail.  It is a three-day outdoor festival, located in Lions head Village and the picturesque Arrabelle at Vail Square, June 28, 29 and June 30, 2013.</p>
