The juried artist market features artwork from 225 of the best artists in the southeast region and beyond, in a variety of media including painting, clay, glass, jewelry, photography, printmaking, fiber, wood, metal and mixed media.             <p>The West Linn Fine Arts Festival (WLAF) is a juried exhibition and sale of fine arts and crafts produced and managed by artists for artists. In our fourteenth year of this event we are moving to Marylhurst University in Marylhurst, OR. Marylhurst is located within the Portland metropolitan area, just 20 minutes from downtown Portland, and lies on state highway 43 between the communities of West Linn and Lake Oswego. The festival, featuring primarily local and regional artists from the Pacific Northwest and/or the West Coast, is a celebration of creativity and a showcase for original fine art in all media.</p>

            <p>West Reading&rsquo;s 19th Annual Art on the Avenue, is a juried fine arts and crafts festival featuring national and regional artists showing and selling their creations on Penn Avenue in West Reading, Pennsylvania. Each year thousands of people are drawn to Art on the Avenue as the event continues to grow. Located in the Greater Reading hub for arts, culture, shopping, and dining, this event appeals to both novice buyers and experienced art patrons. As a talented artisan we invite you to exhibit at this juried art event. Additionally the venue features live music, street performers, local businesses, and specialty foods.</p>

            <p><br />
The <strong>Westchester (Scarsdale) Festival of the Art</strong>s returns for its <strong>fifth year</strong> to central Westchester County, again graciously hosted by the Scardsdale Chamber of Commerce.&nbsp; The show sets up on the downtown streets of The Village amidst elegant Tudor architecture, high-end shops and surrounded by numerous parks and extensive green spaces. The median income for a family is over $200,000.&nbsp; Within a 25-mile radius are Manhattan, Armonk and Greenwich, CT.&nbsp;<br />
<br />
This fine art festival is still in a growth stage. It offers the strongest regional demographics in terms of both wealth and culture. Artists that need volume sales may find this a challenging market. Average sales have risen each year for this show. The Festival tends to be a show where artists either succeed well - or do not. This is a small boutique show geared to a smaller but extremely affluent patronage that forms the Scarsdale-Westchester clientele base.<br />
<br />
<span style="color:#0000ff;"><strong>2010 AVERAGE SALES: $2433<br />

            <p><br />
Central Florida has celebrated The Winter Park Sidewalk Art Festival&trade; for more than a half century. This juried show is nationally recognized and has been named one of the top outdoor art shows in the country year after year. Unusual in today&rsquo;s art world, the show is brought to you by an all-volunteer committee and features original artwork that has been designed and executed by the exhibiting artists during the past two years. The show is conveniently located in Central Park, a beautifully landscaped area whose surrounding streets are closed during the Festival to allow for foot traffic only. Artists&rsquo; booths nestle under large oak trees in the park and line Winter Park&rsquo;s Park Avenue, the heart of a charming downtown with brick streets, unique boutique shops, and multiple outdoor cafes and bistros. Attendance usually exceeds 350,000 people for the three-day event, which celebrates its 55th year on March 21, 22, and 23, 2014. No more than 225 artists are selected for participation each year.<br />
</p>
            <b><a href='event-info-public.php?fair_id=2753' target='new'>VIEW MORE INFO</a></b>

            Kansas City, Missouri - Central Region<br>
            <strong></strong><br><br>
            Application Deadline: <b>7/17/13 Midnight CST <span style='color:red'>Deadline Past</span></b><br>

            Show Dates: <b>9/13/13 - 9/15/13</b><br>
            <!--<i>(All dates are subject to change. Confirm all dates with the event administrators.)</i><br>-->
            <p>The annual Zona Rosa Arts Festival, September 13-15, 2013, is a juried fine arts festival sponsored by Zona Rosa. The three day festival is free for the public to attend and features the talents of qualifying national and regional artists along with live musical and dance performances at Town Square.<br />
<br />
The festival takes place in Zona Rosa, a dynamic shopping, dining, and entertainment district located just minutes from downtown Kansas City and Kansas City International Airport. Zona Rosa is a new urban retail development that opened in the Northland of Kansas City, Missouri in May, 2004. Zona Rosa is a mixed-use development, combining retail, restaurant and entertainment venues, along with office space and residential lofts and luxury apartments. The open-air, pedestrian-friendly center features a town square, children&rsquo;s park and fountains, all designed to make Zona Rosa the premier shopping, dining and gathering spot for the local community.</p>
